And then make bolls of the atta and make 2 thick rottis of it (in round shape).and in left mashed atta add some hari mirch,hara dhaniya(coriander)and add salt to it and make tikki of it.
Take one of the rotti put makhan to it and mungfali ki chattnito on itans then put aloo ki tikki on it.
Then put slices of tomato,kheera and put some salt and kali mirch onit.
Then put paneer slice on it and covered it with makhan putten on that paratha.
And then serve it with tomato chattni or coriander chattni.

recipeDescription: Prepare the traditional spicy and tangy Baigan chutney with baigan or brinjals blended with garlic, chillies and tamarind. A perfect tangy accompaniment to any main course meal fare.
preparationMethod: First clean the brinjal, peel the skin and cut into four pieces and keep in salt water.
Grind to paste the chilly,garlic jeera.
Mix the grinded paste to the brinjal after removing water in a seperate pan or kadhai.
Add oil,salt to taste and vinger 1tbspor the tamrind as per your sourness, and water to the prepartion.
Keep it on a low flame till the brinjal is cooked tenderly .

recipeDescription: Cooked baingans stir fried in a delcios mix of masalas and condiments to give a unique and spicy taste.
preparationMethod: Boil the baingan in water with tamarind and turmeric powder and salt, mix well and cook till the brinjals are half cooked.
Strain the excess water and keep aside. Keep aside.
Combine the remaining ingredients, mix well and roast for a minute.
Blend in a mixer to a smooth powder.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, add the asafoetida and the brinjal and saute till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Remove from the flame, add the grounded masalas and mix well.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: A spicy eggplant or brinjal(baigan) bhurta recipe with roasted brinjals mashed and cooked with onion, tomato and ginger-garlic paste. The baigan bharta recipe is just rightly spiced to suit all palates. A simple yet unique variation to a typical brinjal preparation.
preparationMethod: Wash brinjal, make slits, apply oil and cook on a direct flame, turning the brinjal , till the skin turns dark and wrinkled.
Peel and mash the brinjals properly.
Heat the oil in a kadai, add the green chillies, garlic and onions and saute till they turn brown in colour.
Add the tomatoes and saute until it turns soft.
Add the masala powders and turmeric and salt, mix well and cook till the oil leaves the sides.
Add mashed brinjal and coriander leaves along with 1/2 cup water, mix well and cook till the gravy becomes thick.
Just before serving heat ghee and add to the burta, mix well
Serve hot with phulkas.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: Basically it's an open sandwich made with pizza toppings. Simple yet scrumptious. A mixture of chopped veggies and spices is spread on bread slices and sprinkled with yummy mozzarella cheese and baked in the oven.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients except bread, cheese and ketchup in a bowl and mix well.
Arrange bread slices on a greased baking tray and apply littl ketchup on each slice followed by cheese.
Top it with the prepared mixture.
Then sprinkle more cheese.
Bake in a preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes until cheese melts and bread is nice and crusty.

recipeDescription: Marinara sauce makes a great dip for the above recipe.
preparationMethod: Combine dry ingredients.
cut in butter and cheese with pastry blender; stir in sour cream.
Shape into a ball and chill 2 hours.
on a lightly floured surface, roll out dough 1/8-inch thick.
Cut into strips 1/4-inch wide and 3 inches long.
bake at 425° for 8 minutes. let cool and serve with you favorite dips.

recipeDescription: Can serve it with pita or taco chips
preparationMethod: Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).
In a large mixing bowl, combine cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, half of the olives, jalapeno peppers, garlic and hot pepper sauce. spread the mixture into a 9-inch pie pan.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until heated through. sprinkle over the dish the remaining olives, chopped tomatoes and green onions.

recipeDescription: Baked penne in tomato sauce is a tangy and cheesy preparation. While boiling pastas, add a few drops of oil in the boiling water, so that the pastas will not stick to each other.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a pan, add the onions and garlic and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the tomato puree and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes.
Add the coriander-cumin powder, chilli powder, oregano, salt and mix well and futher simmer for 5 minutes. Keep aside.
Grease a baking dish with butter.
Put a pasta layer in the dish, top it with the tomato sauce, sprinkle chilli flakes and sliced mushrooms over the sauce layer.
Finally spread the cheese evenly covering all the sides and top with capsicum rings.
Bake in a pre-heated oven and bake till the cheese melts.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Baked rajmah delight presents a protein and calcium rich baked beans recipe with the cooked rajmah beans topped with chopped capsicum and grated cheese and then baked till the cheese melts. Enjoy with toasted french bread.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the ginger garlic paste and saute for 1 minute/
Add the onions and saute till they turn golden brown in colour.
Add the tomatoes and saute till the oil separates.
Add the tomato ketchup , salt and pepper and saute on a medium flame for a minute.
Add the soaked rajmah and saute for 2 minutes.
Pressure cook for 3 to 4 whistles, or till the rajma are cooked.
Transfer in a greased baking dish and sprinkle the chopped capsicum and grated cheese evenly on top.
Bake in a pre-heated oven till the cheese melts.
Serve hot with toasted french bread.

recipeDescription: Baked tofu nuggets, tofu marinated in soy sauce and bake till brown. It is best to serve as a starter for the parties.
preparationMethod: Cut the tofu into 1/4" to 1/2" slices and press between layers of paper towel for about 1 to 2 hours. Keep aside.
Combine the soy sauce and pepper powder, mix well and add the tofu, mix well and keep aside to marinate for 2-4 hours.
Before baking, add sesame seeds and toss well.
Bake at 350 degree celsius, until the tofu is lightly browned and has a crisp texture.
Serve immediately with tomato sauce.

ingredients: cloves of garlic (lehsun), peeled and sliced
recipeDescription: Basic curry sauce is an Indian sauce recipe with onions, tomatoes and ginger garlic paste cooked together. The traditional brown sauce curry can be used as a base for fish, chicken or paneer dishes.
preparationMethod: Method
Heat the oil in a heavy pan then add the chopped onion and stir for a few minutes with the heat on high.
Add the ginger, garlic and green chilli (if using). stir for 30 seconds then put the heat down to very low.
Cook for 15 minutes stirring from time to time making sure nothing browns or burns.
Add the turmeric, cumin and coriander and cook, still very gently, for a further 5 minutes. don't burn the spices or the sauce will taste horrid - sprinkle on a few drops of water if you're worried.
Take off the heat and cool a little. put 4 fl oz cold water in a blender, add the contents of the pan and whizz until very smooth. add the passata and stir.

Put the puréed mixture back into the pan and cook for 20 - 30 minutes (the longer the better) over very low heat stirring occasionally. you can add a little hot water if it starts to catch on the pan but the idea is to gently "fry" the sauce which will darken in colour to an orangy brown. the final texture should be something like good tomato ketch

recipeDescription: Handy tip's) : 1. you can also flavour the batter with chilli powder or garlic paste or spinach purée to make spicy sev, garlic sev or spinach sev.
preparationMethod: Combine the bengal gram flour, oil, asafoetida and turmeric powder, salt and approximately 3 tablespoons of water to make a stiff dough.
Fill the dough into a sev "press" and press out thin strands into hot oil.
Deep fry on a slow flame till light brown and crisp.
Cool and store in an air-tight container.

recipeDescription: You can also stir in 1/2 to 3/4 cup grated cheese or 2 teaspoons prepared mustard and a dash of worcestershire sauce after cooking the basic white sauce.
preparationMethod: Place butter/margarine in a dish and haet on high for 20-30 seconds.
Stir in flour and salt.
Add milk,stirring until smooth.
Cook on medium for 3 to 4 min.
And your white sauce is ready.

recipeDescription: It is very nutritious,good for cold ,low fat,and delicious
preparationMethod: In a pressure cooker put all ingredients,and steam for 2 1/2 minutes,then remove from pressure cooker add 2 table spoon fresh cream,garnish with corriander leaves,serve hot with soup sticks

recipeDescription: An easy, tasty and healthy recipe to prepare Bean Sprout which can be made into salads, stir fries or added to any vegetable dish.
preparationMethod: Wash the moong and soak in water for a minimum 4 hours.
Drain thoroughly and wait for 5 minutes.
Keep in a jar covered with a piece of cloth for 5 to 6 hours.
Place in the refrigerator overnight.
Next day, wash thoroughly, drain and again keep in a jar covered with a piece of coth for 5 to 6 hours.
Place in the refrigerator overnight.
Sprinkle water on the sprouted beans on the third day and store in the refrigerator until required for use.

recipeDescription: A tasty and healthy sandwich which will tempt your your tastebuds to have more than one...
preparationMethod: Blend the pulses in a mixer till smooth.
Transfer in a bowl and add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Divide the mixture into 8 equal portions and shape them into small round flat tikkis.
Heat the oil in a tava and shallow fry the tikkis till they turn golden brown and crisp from both the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and keep aside.
Toast the bread slices with butter till golden brown on a nonstick pan.
Apply the spread on toasted bread slice and place the tikki on top and put the onion, capsicum and tomato slices on top.
Cover with a cheese slice, and grill the sandwich till cheese melts.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: Beany mushroom offer a perfect blend of great taste, great looks and great health value. The mushroom buttons are scooped out and then filled with a spicy bean or rajmah mixture. Top the stuffed mushrooms with cheese and bake till the cheese melts. A yummy vegetable dish.
preparationMethod: 1.take out the stalks of the mushrooms and make them into empty cup shaped form.
2.chop the stalks of the mushrooms and keep aside.
3.chop the onions and the capsicum and in 1 teaspoon of oil cook till half done and then add the chopped stalks.
Cook till the mushrooms are done.
4.crumble the biscuits and mix salt and black pepper in it.add this biscuit /cracker mixture to the cooked chopped vegetables .
5.then to this mixture add the beans.
Cook and mix them weel and keep aside.
6.fill the mushrooms with this mixture .
7.brush a little butter outside the mushrooms.
8.top them with the shredded cheese.
9.cover a baking tray with aluminium foil and arrange the mushrooms on it.
10.put the mushrooms in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes ortill the cheese melts and covers the mushroom tops.

recipeDescription: It worked when my cousin had a bee sting
preparationMethod: Relieve the sting from a bee sting with baking soda or meat tenderizer: make a thick paste with either powder and a little water; gently drop the goop onto the sting site. what makes a bee sting hurt is a protein, which gets transformed into something harmless by the baking soda.

recipeDescription: Use more garlic for better taste and health!!!
preparationMethod: Blend the cooked beetroot along with rasam powder and coconut and little water, in a mixer to a fine paste.
Boil the tamarind pulp with salt, turmeric and green chilli for 10 minutes.
Add the ground mixture, add 1 cup of water and boil for 5-7 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat 1 tsp oil in a small pan and add the garlic and saute till they turn golden brow.
Add these garlic to the rasam and mix well.
Heat 1 tsp of oil for the tempering, add the mustard seeds and red chilli.
When the seeds crackle, pour this tempering over the rasam and mix well.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipeDescription: 1.tastes great after chilling in refrigerator for some time. 2. beetroot contains lots of iron and healthy vitamins.
preparationMethod: Wash and grate beetroots.
Chop onions and green chillis and add to grated beetroot.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds to prepare tempering.
Pour the tempering on the salad and add salt to taste.

recipeDescription: Comment : the coriander-cumin powder goes really well with the bell peppers and paneer adds a nice crunch to the dish. tip : if u have trouble cutting paneer into cubes coz they tend to break, use a warm knife.
preparationMethod: 1.fry seperately panner cubes in enough oil till they just about turn brown.be careful not to overcook.
2.heat oil in a non stick pan.add cumin seeds and onion fry till onions brown a little.
3.then add garlic and bell peppers.cover and cook for about 6 mins or till the bell pepper soften a little.
4.add the previousy fried panner cubes.
5.then add salt,pepper,red chilli powder and cumin-coriander powder and toss around till all the ingredients are incorporated.
6.garnish wid coriander leaves.

recipeDescription: This is a traditional bengali recipe.
preparationMethod: Wash brinjal, make slits, apply oil and cook on a direct flame, turning the brinjal , till the skin turns dark and wrinkled.
Peel and mash the brinjals properly.
Heat the oil in a kadai, add the green chillies, garlic and onions and saute till they turn brown in colour.
Add the tomatoes and saute until it turns soft.
Add the masala powders and turmeric and salt, mix well and cook till the oil leaves the sides.
Add mashed brinjal and coriander leaves along with 1/2 cup water, mix well and cook till the gravy becomes thick.
Just before serving heat ghee and add to the burta, mix well
Serve hot with phulkas.

recipeDescription: Mouth watering and irresistible smoothie ...which is surely healthy at the same time.....
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients and blend in a mixer till the ice is crushed and mixture is thick smooth.
Pour it equally into 2 glasses.
Top each glass with a strawberry.
Serve chilled immediately.

recipeDescription: A tangy tongue twisting summer drink.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Fill a hurricane glass with ice cubes and some blueberry dessert topping.
Pour and serve chilled.

recipeDescription: Bhindi should be wiped properly after washing to keep it from sticking. . . Gives a mixed flavour of lemon and bhindi.
preparationMethod: Divide the ladies fingers into lengthwise and keep aside.
Combine all the ingredients along with the slit ladies finger in a bowl and mix well.
Heat oil in the kadhai, add the ladies finger and deep fry till it turns golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: The cheela comes out best when generously roasted with oil. you can add freshly grated cauliflower or cheese too. innovate!
preparationMethod: Mix all the ingredients in a bowl
Add enough water to make a dosa-consistency paste
Heat a non-stick tawa well
Oil the tawa when ready
Pour one big ladle of the batter per dosa
Add oil as per taste
Let cook on high to medium flame
Make the cheela thickness as per taste
Serve with achaar/fresh coconut chutney/fresh tomato chutney

recipeDescription: A light breakfast and a snack too..
preparationMethod: Take besan in a vessel. Add water and salt to it .
Start mixing the mixture with the help of a hand mixer or a big spoon. Make sure there should be no lumps.
Pour this mixture in a pan or kadhai. Keep it in on the low-medium flame. Keep on stirring continuously until the mixture thickens(not too much). Switch off the flame.
Pour the batter into a greased flat vessel or thali. Let it cool for 10 minutes.
For seasoning, heat a pan with oil, add curry leaves, mustard seeds and finely chopped green chilies.
When seed starts popping, remove and pour over the cooked besan batter in the thali.
Sprinkle some grated coconut over it.
Garnish it with coriander and cut into pieces.
Serve.

recipeDescription: Besan omlette or besan chilla recipe with gram flour mixed together with onion, tomatoes, chillies and spices before spreading on a non-stick pan like pancake. A vegetarian omelette recipe, besan omelette taste superb with a green chutney or sauce of choice.
preparationMethod: Grind green chilies, ginger and garlic to a paste.
Mix besan, ground paste, cumin seeds, coriander leaves and chopped tomato.
Add water and make thin batter.
Adjust salt.
Heat a tawa, grease with a little oil and then and pour a little batter. spread into a thin round and then cook till done.
Then fold it and serve immediately.

recipeDescription: A tasty tiffin as well as breakfast recipe. Really easy and fast to make. Consumes very less amount of time and yes kids will love it.
preparationMethod: Combine the besan, chilli powder, turmeric powder, salt and water in a bowl and mix nicely using a whisk to ensure there are no lumps.
Once the batter is ready, add the tomatoes, capsicum and green chillies and mix well.
In a flat non stick pan heat the oil.
Once the oil is heated add small quantities of batter in the pan and gently spread evenly on all sides.
Cook for 1 minute on both the sides and prepare the omlettes till is batter is complete.
Keep aside.
Apply butter or cheese on the toasted bread.
Add the besan omlettes on the toast and it's ready to serve.
For packing it in tiffin, apply omlette on one side of the toast and place another slice on the top.
Serve with tomato ketchup.

recipeDescription: This crunchy snack can be enjoyed anytime in a day with or without tea,can have as a time pass snacks
preparationMethod: Combine the flour, semolina, besan, salt, carom seeds, asafoetida, chilli powder and oil in a bowl, mix well and knead into a smooth dough adding enough water as required.
Cover with damp cloth and set aside at least for fifteen minutes.
Knead the dough for another minute and divide into four equal parts.
Take each part of the dough and make a flat ball shape.
Roll them thin and prick them with a fork all over the rolled dough so that the paare do not puff when frying.
Cut each of the rolled dough into about half inch wide and 3 inch long pieces.
Heat the oil in a frying pan on medium heat.
Make sure to place just enough paare so you can turn them over easily when frying.
Fry the paare until both sides are light golden-brown.
Cool and serve.

recipeDescription: Besan pancakes or as commonly known as tomato omelette is a vegetarian gram flour based pancake or omelette recipe. The gram flour batter is mixed with chopped onion, tomatoes and chillies and then spread on a pan . Relish the hot and crispy besan pancakes with ketchup or green chutney.
preparationMethod: Mix besan, salt ajwain, green chillies and all the chopped vegetables and mix it well.
Add enough water to make a thin-medium consistency batter.
Mix well to avoid any lumps
Heat the tava and put some about 1/2 teaspoon of oil when the tava is hot enough pour a spoonful of batter and spread it out just a little bit maintaining about 1/2 an inch thickness.
Pour some oil around and on the pancakes.
After a minute toss the pancake the other side.
Both the sides of the pancake should be golden brown. then take the pancake out.
Serve the pancakes while hot with mint chutney or with tomato ketchup

recipeDescription: The tomatoe and onions have to be really small otherwise the besan wont spread easily on the tawa. the same batter can be used to make small size besan dosas and be served with the stuffing as a topping and garnish with coriander.
preparationMethod: Mix ingredients of bowl 1 with water to make a smooth batterand spread thin on non stick tawa to be spread like a dosa. put little oil and once little crispy brown take out on tissue paper.make equal size 6 besan dosas
Mix ingredients of bowl 2 in a bowl .this will form the stuffing.
Fill the stuffing in each besan dosa and make a roll.put toothpick so that the dosas dont open . serve hot on plate, garnish with coriander chuttni and tomatoe ketchup

recipeDescription: Make sure to dry the bhindi completely.
preparationMethod: Divide the ladies fingers into lengthwise and keep aside.
Combine all the ingredients along with the slit ladies finger in a bowl and mix well.
Heat oil in the kadhai, add the ladies finger and deep fry till it turns golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Bhakarwadi is a traditional spicy maharastrian snack recipe which requires effort but can be stored for weeks and enjoyed with evening tea. The flour based round discs are stuffed with roasted poppy seeds, steamed and then finally deep fried to a crispy finish.
preparationMethod: Sieve the besan, refined flour, chilli powder, asafoetida and salt together and transfer in a bowl.
Knead into a stiff dough along with 2 tsp oil and using little water. Keep aside.
Divide the stuffing into equal portions and keep aside.
Divide the dough into equal portions as the stuffing and roll out each portion into a small circle for 2" diameter.
Place a portion if the stuffing and roll out like a cylinder.
Make more such vadis using all the stuffing and dough.
Arrange all the flutes in a plate and steam for 20 minutes.
Cool and cut them into 2 cm round discs.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry these vadis till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot or store in an air-tight container.

recipeDescription: An Uttaranchal specialty made with bhang seeds grinded to make a delicious chutney. Serve as an accompaniment to other dishes.
preparationMethod: First fried bhang seeds in tava and grind it with a little water to make chutney.
When it become paste add lime juice and salt to taste.

recipeDescription: Tasty and crispy bittergourd stuffed with a filling of onions, jeera and anardana.
preparationMethod: Apply the salt in karelas, scrub well and keep aside.
Combine the anardana ,onion and cumin seeds, salt and mix well.
Fill the prepared masala in the karelas and tie with thread.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a kadhai and arrange karela in pan, cover and cook turning sides so that all sides become brown and the karela becomes soft.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Bharwan baingan is a delicious stuffed baigan or brinjal recipe. The eggplants are sliced lengthwise and filled up with an awesome blend of indian spice powders such as ajwain(carrom seeds), cumin ,asafoetida, mustard seeds, etc.
preparationMethod: Wash and slit the brinjals length wise from the base towards the stalk, dividing first into half and making another slit dividing each into quarters.
Stuff each brinjal with the prepared filling and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a pan, add the brinjals and mix gently.
Cover and cook till the brinjals turn tender, stirring a few times in between.
Serve hot garnished with sliced ginger.

recipeDescription: Veg lajawaab is true to its name and is simply awesome in taste! An easy mixed vegetable preparation with cream and choicest spices, this Veg lajawaab is sure to be appreciated by one and all.
preparationMethod: 1. in a bowl, mix all the ingredients together.
2. adjust the chili powder according to taste.
3. serve immediately in individual plates.

recipeDescription: A very unique salad and very tasty to eat.
preparationMethod: Wash and dry bhindi.cut the top and the bottom.
Heat oil and when hot add the bhindi and saute on medium heat till just cooked.a little crispness should be there.
Put in a serving bowl.roast the capsicum and cut to pieces.
Add to the bhindi.
Now add the grated cheese,chilli flakes,salt and pepper and toss well.serve.

recipeDescription: A quick and easy toast recipe.
preparationMethod: Apply butter on one side of each bread slice.
Combine the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Spread some mixture on each bread slice and top with another bread.
Put it in sandwich toaster or griller and cook till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: I am into home cooking since long time. I have tried making some dishes at home. I would like to share one of them here. This dish is called "Bischoc Balls". Bischoc means Chocolate + Biscuits. It is made without cooking or baking. It's is very easy. Everyone, from kids to elderly, loves it.
preparationMethod: In a deep bowl combine the biscuits, choco chips, gems and lots of choco syrup.
Add just milk enough milk to make a dough.
Divide the dough into equal portions to make small balls.
Roll the balls over powdered biscuits and drizzle the chocolate syrup over it.
Refrigerate for 10 minutes and enjoy the divine taste of it.

recipeDescription: The whole procedure should not be more than 15 mins.
preparationMethod: 1. take a pan with 1 tbsp of ghee and roast all the dry fruits in it.
2. take another pan with 1 tbsp of ghee and add black seedless dates and smash it for 12 mins on a medium flame with datta till the moisture is gone.
3. once the moisture is gone, then add roasted dry fruits and mix well for 2 mins.
4. now close the flame and let it cool for 3-4 mins.
5. put little bit of ghee in both hands to make rolls of dates.
6. once the rolls are little cool make fine slices.

ingredients: dill leaves (shepu / suva bhaji) dill seeds (suva dana)
preparationMethod: Mix all ingredients well with cracked ice and serve in a chilled collins glass with additional ice cubes if needed.

recipeDescription: Boiled egg delight – Chinese style is a non veg recipe with the halved boiled eggs topped with spring onions and vegetable tossed with soy sauce, vinegar and tomato chilly sauce. Enjoy with chapatis.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a pan.
Add finely chopped onions, chillies, ginger and garlic. Stir and fry till golden brown.
Add ajinomoto, vinegar, soya sauce, sweet chilli sauce , salt and stir fry till the sauce dries up.
Place half cut boiled eggs in a serving plate. Put the above fried onion mixture on the eggs.
Garnish with spring onions and serve hot with chapattis.
Same preparation can be used as a filling for sandwiches using toasted bread.

recipeDescription: A simple and yet so tasty and healthy sandwich recipe, the Bread egg sandwich has the boiled eggs sliced and then added in between the bread slices along with cheese and seasonings. Enjoy the sandwich plain or grilled with ketchup.
preparationMethod: For stuffing
1.in a kadai put the oil and add the eggs and fry them. then add salt,pepper powderand fry them till they are done.
2.then take two breads slices and on one end apply some butter and add the stuffing inbetween two breads and place it on the toaster with the covered bread top greased with butter.
Through the indicator of the toaster the bread sandwhich is ready to eat hot.

recipeDescription: The quantity of onions can vary as per taste. can also add chopped tomatoes if wanted....
preparationMethod: Chop the onions into fine pieces.
Break the bread slices into small pieces
Heat the iol in a big enough kadai
Add the mustard seeds and once they start crackeling add the onions....
Stir for a minute or till the onions become soft and pinkish
Add the red chilli, green chilli, dhaniya, turmeric powder and salt
Stir for about a minute...
Then add the bread pieces and stir till all the masala mixes well with the bread....
Sprinkle a few drops of water and cover the kadai for about a minute....
Remove from heat, add lemon juice on the top and green dhaiya leaves for garnish...

recipeDescription: A simple and quick evening snack!
preparationMethod: Combine the besan,chilli powder, salt, turmeric powder and cumin seeds powder in a deep bowl and make a thin batter adding enough water.
Apply this batter on both sides of the bread.
Sprinkle the cucumber and tomato on one side of the bread and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a pan and cook each bad slice using little oil, till it becomes crisp and golden brown in colour from both the sides.
Serve hot with chaat masala and chutney.

recipeDescription: Bread pizza ready to eat without oven.
preparationMethod: Heat non-stick tavaon gas.
Put 2 bread slices on it
Heat on slow flame
When it is slightly cooked turn the another side.
Apply tomato sauceevenly.
Put cheese sliceonit.
Mix salt and black pepperinto the veg.
Spread veg. evenly on the slice
Cover the tava witha plate.
When the bread becomes golden brown,ur bread is ready to eat.
Garnish it with a grated cheese

recipeDescription: Their is no hard and fast rule of making this, you can add any vegetables. regarding cheese you can add grated one or simply put one slice, or you can even add melted one. kids really freak with this.
preparationMethod: 1.take bread and spread ketchup and arrange all the vegetables over it.
2.spread uniformly grated cheese over it
3.put them in oven for 10-15 min at 350f
4.season with black paper and flakes.
5.serve hot.

recipeDescription: If there is no tomato puree u can add tomato ketchup.
preparationMethod: Add tomato puree to sooji, some water if the paste is too thick to spread.
Add chopped onion, red chilli powder and salt to taste.
Spread the paste on one side of the bread sprinkle mixed herbs and cheeze on the top of the spread. shallow fry the side without the paste till the paste thickens and holds, then flip over.
Wait for a minute or till done. serve hot with tomato sause.

recipeDescription: It gives fantastic taste with double cream,it is quite healthy and can eat as a main course.
preparationMethod: Firstly chopped all given vegetables in a very little small pieces.
Mix all of them in a pan then add samolina uptill can mix all vegetables,add cream(malai),add salt to taste.mix it well so it will be like little bit thiicker pastry.
Now,cut the slice of bread in triangle shape,then stick(put)the pastry (mixture) on the bread and make a thin layer.

Then,hit a nonstick flat pan on the gas by adding 2 to 3 tb.spoon of oil with medium temperature and shallow fry the bread first on the side of the mixture and then turn to next side.fry it till goldon brown colour.
Serve with tomato ketch up.

recipeDescription: A yummy and quick pizza made with bread as the base topped with various healthy veggies and cheese
preparationMethod: Mix finely chopped onion, capsicum, tomatoe, green chilli,ginger paste,salt and garam masala.
Now add suji and water to the above mixture to make a paste.
Keep the paste aside for 5 minutes.
Now take a bread slice and spread this paste evenly on the bread slice.
Heat non-stick flat pan and spread some cooking oil on it.
Shallow fry the bread, first from the side of paste and then turn it back and let it be fried from the other side also.

recipeDescription: You can use non-stick tava for baking pizzas in place of oven. keep the heat low.
preparationMethod: Mix all the ingrediants except bread. now, spread the mixture on each bread slice and bake for 5 minutes in preheated oven. serve hot.

recipeDescription: Quick and a simple snack made in microwave Kids are sure to love this!
preparationMethod: Spread the butter evenly on one side of the bread slices. Place them on a grill and grill till they turn crisp and golden brown.
Apply a little more butter and ketchup on the other side and spread equal amounts of vegetables, cheese, oregano and basil and sprinkle little salt.
Place them in the microwave grill for and grill for 5 to 6 minutes.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: bread poha recipe | veg bread poha | easy bread poha with tomatoes, onions | with amazing 16 images. bread poha recipe is has been adapted from the famous Maharashtrian poha recipe. Who does not love Poha! An everyday food, Poha is loved all over the country and often enjoyed as a breakfast of snack. Here, the regular Poha recipe has been adapted for bread cubes. A traditional tempering and veggies like onions, tomatoes and capsicum transform the bread cubes into a sumptuous Veg Bread Poha, which is enhanced further by the addition of peppy garam masala. Kids generally make a fuss for eating Indian snacks but make this bread poha and it’s a perfect after school snack. I am sure your kid would gulp it down in minutes. The procedure is very simple and quick for Bread Poha recipe, How to make Bread Poha, Easy bread poha. Heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds. When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds. Add the onions and green chillies, green chillies can be adjusted to your preference of spice. Add the capsicum and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes. Add the turmeric powder and tomatoes and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes. Add the bread pieces, salt and peppy garam masala, mix well and cook while stirring occasionally. Serve hot garnished with coriander which would add freshness to bread poha. Indeed, this satiating snack of easy bread poha with tomatoes, onions is something that both kids and adults will love, and it is also convenient and easy to make, with simple everyday ingredients found in the Indian kitchen. So, when you come home hungry and find nothing but bread and veggies in your fridge, you know what to make. Enjoy bread poha recipe | veg bread poha | easy bread poha with tomatoes, onions | with detailed step by step recipe photos and video.
preparationMethod: To make bread poha, heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.
Add the onions and green chillies and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the capsicum and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the turmeric powder and tomatoes and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the bread pieces, salt and garam masala, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Switch off the flame, add the lemon juice and mix well.
Serve the bread poha hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: Its ideal dish for children's tiffin box. it can be eaten for breakfast in the morning or can be eaten for brunch. its healthy & filling.
preparationMethod: 1)put oil in a pan & heat it.
2)add mustard seeds & urad daal & curry leaves.
After the urad daal has become pink add onions,cook till its pink.
3)add tomatoes & cook for a few mins.
4)add the bread pieces,
5) then add ketchup & chilii suace(optional)
6)allow it to cook for a few mins.
6)remove it in a plate & top it with coriander leaves.

recipeDescription: The bread upma is a delectable upma recipe with crushed, water soaked bread pieces as ingredient. The bread upma is cooked just like semolina upma with onion, mustard seeds, curry leaves, lime juice and chopped coriander leaves. An excellent breakfast item, bread upma is easy and delicious variation to a traditional rawa upma.
preparationMethod: Cut bread into small pieces.keep aside
Put oil in kadai, put musturd, curry leaves and onion fry till brown then put haldi.
Remove from fire let to cool.
tnen add salt & bread peices & coriander lemon. mix well.
Bread upma ready to eat

recipeDescription: A popular bread cheese toast recipe is an easy and quick recipe to prepare cheese toasts. The delicious cheese toasts melt in the mouth and are loved by all.
preparationMethod: Chop onions and tomatoes.heat
Oil and saute onions till brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste,tomato,
Greenchilli and stirwell.heat tava
And toast the bread.spread the
Mixture on bread.put grated cheese
On top.put another bread on top.

recipeDescription: Go ahead and prepare the innovative egg preparation, Bread-omelette curry and enjoy this egg dipped bread slices simmered in spicy gravy with paranthas or Rotis. A nice variation to the traditional boiled egg curry recipe, bread omelette curry is easy to prepare and delicious..
preparationMethod: Beat eggs with enough salt and chilli powder.
Add quarter spoon of the enitre ginger garlic paste and garam masala powder to the egg mixture.beat thoroughly.
Dip entire slice of bread and make bombay or french toast ready for the main curry.
Saute chopped onions,green chillis,tomatoes with remaning ginger - garlic paste and garam masala powder.
Now add diced bombay or french toast to the masala.
Add tamarind pulp with enough water and cook for seven minutes.
Add chopped corriander for garnish.
Serve with hot parathas or mild flavoured pulav.

recipeDescription: Really amazing breakfast...
preparationMethod: Break eggs into one bowl.
Stir them and add pepper and salt and whisk well.
Cut the bread from edge.
On a pan add 1 tsp of oil and keep on stove on high power.
Dip the bread in egg mixture and fry it on a pan.
Pan fry properly from both sides.
Sprinkle some oregano on it.
Serve hot with coffee.

recipeDescription: A delicious evening snack with tea.
preparationMethod: Cut the brinjal into round slices, put them in water.
Combine the green chilly, coriander , cumin seeds, garlic, salt and blaned in a mixer to a powder, without adding water. Keep aside.
Combine the besan, soda, salt, chilli powder, turmeric powder, and a tbsp of hot oil along with water and mix well in one direction.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, stuff the green chilli mix in between the two slices of brinjal and dip this sandwich in besan batter and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Drain on an absorbent paper.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Brinjal kotsu is a south indian recipe to prepare brinjals or egg plants in spices, grated coconut and then seasoning it with mustard seeds, curry leaves and red chillies.
preparationMethod: Apply a little oil on the brinjals and roast on an open flame , till it is cripsy brown and the outer skin breaks up.
Keep aside.
Add little water to the tamarind pulp and mix well and keep aside.
Mash the roasted brinjals while it is hot and add the tamarind pulp and mix well.
Add the salt and turmeric and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove from the flame and keep aside.
For the tempering, heat the oil in a small pan, add the mustard seeds, curry leaves and green chillies and asfoetida and saute till the seeds crackle.
Pour this tempering to the brinjals, mix well and serve hot.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch) powder
recipeDescription: Broccoli & dolcelatte flan is a cream and broccoli filled flan or pastry recipe which can be prepared easily and enjoyed as a tea time snack or starter. The blanched broccoli is mixed with yoghurt, eggs and Dolcelatte cheese and then filled in the pastry cases before getting baked to a crispy finish.
preparationMethod: Preheat the oven to 200c, 400f, gas mark 6.
Roll out the pastry and use it to line a 20cm flan case. bake blind in the preheated for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle the onions and dolcelatte over the pastry base, and arrange the broccoli florets on top.
Beat together the natural yogurt and eggs, season to taste and pour into the flan case.
Return to the oven for 25-30 minutes, until set and golden.

recipeDescription: Enjoy this low cal soup with goodness of fibre from broccoli. You can enjoy this soup warm/cold depending on your preference.
preparationMethod: Heat up oil in a pan and sauté onion and garlic for a minute.
Add celery and salt and stir well.
Add 2 cups of water and cover the pan and allow to cook for 4-5 mins.
After 5 minutes, add the broccoli and cook for 5 minutes.
Remove from the flame and cool it a bit and blend it to thin consistency in a blender.
Pass it through a sieve if want and allow it to boil for 3-4 mins.
Add pepper and garnish with broccoli florets.
Adjust the taste of pepper and consistency as per your wish.

recipeDescription: Broccoli and Mushroom Quesadillas is a kid friendly snack recipe with cheese, broccoli and mushrooms spooned into the tortilla cups and baked till done. Enjoy the healthy Mexican snack delight, quesadillas with sauce or plain.
preparationMethod: Saute the onion; mushrooms, garlic and herbs in the butter over medium heat until lightly browned, about 10 min. add salt and pepper and little red chilli powder(optional)
Spoon this mixture over 4 tortillas that have been placed on lightly greased cookie sheets.
Top each tortilla with broccoli and cheese and a second tortilla.
Bake in a 180 c oven until cheese melts, about 10 min. cut each quesadilla into wedges to serve.

recipeDescription: A superb in taste baked dish recipe, the Broccoli Au Gratin has the crunchy fresh broccoli florets enrobed in white sauce and cheese and baked till perfection.
preparationMethod: Wash & cut broccoli in small flowrests. blanch in boiling water.
Make white sauce with flour, butter & milk.
Add seasonnings & 3/4 of greated cheese.
Toss broccoli in butter.
Arreng broccoli in greased pie dish, pour sauce over it. sprinkle with remaining cheese
Gratinate under salamander or put in oven in water bath for 2-3 mins. at 150 c.

recipeDescription: Broccoli bhanavle is an inspired vegetable preparation with broccoli florets cooked with other vegetables in a besan and coconut milk based gravy. Enjoy baked broccoli bhanavale as a main dish.
preparationMethod: Chop broccoli, onion, coriander & chilly.
Add besan & all the ingredients.
Mix the coconut milk.
Add water to make a paste.
Grease a baking tin.
Pour the mixture in the tin
Bake in the oven for 1/2 hour at 200 c
You can add prawns for non-veg.

recipeDescription: Incorporate the goodness of broccoli along with red onions, and herbs in the Broccoli delight recipe. The broccoli delight makes for an excellent side dish or salad recipe.
preparationMethod: Start by chopping up broccoli heads into small bite size pieces and set aside in a large mixing bowl.
Then finely chop up red onion and add to bowl.
Add the raisins and sunflower seeds.
Next add the poppyseed dressing slowly and mix well.
Note you may not need to use the entire jar of dressing.
Pepper to taste.
Let the mixture marinate in the refidgerator for 2 hours and then serve.

recipeDescription: Prepare a novel Broccoli Dip and serve it as accompaniment with breads, fried snacks or tacos.
preparationMethod: Chop broccoli into fine pieces in a medium bowl or food processor.
Combine broccoli, sour cream, dressing and nutmeg until smooth.

ingredients: a pinch of roasted cumin seeds (jeera) powder black salt (sanchal)
recipeDescription: Do not mix salt and keep it, mix the salt at time when you are ready to serve. this will keep the salad tasty and it wont loose water and taste
preparationMethod: Cut cabbage and tomatoes in to small pieces
Peel the pomogenerate add chillies cut in to small add jeera pdr. and black salt mix well
Garnish with corriander leaves.
1. cut banda gobhi finely ,wash keep in sun for 1\2 hour
2.bounce panch phoran roughly(saunf ,jeera,methi ,kaulaunji ,ajwain)
3.mix panch phoran ,cabbage,salt ,oil ,keep in jar ,and keep in sun ,after 4 days it will be ready.

recipeDescription: Cabbage and onion pakoda is a simple fried pakoda or snack recipe with the mixture consisting of chopped cabbage and onions dipped in a batter and then deep fried. Enjoy this crispy delight with green chutney or sauce of choice.
preparationMethod: Cut the cabbage into small pieces.
Cut the onion into lengthwise and green chilli into small pieces.
Mix all the ingradients with little water and make a thick dough.
Heat oil in a pan, make pakodas with that dough and deep fry them.
Serve hot with tomato sauce.

recipeDescription: Tasty pakodas made in a jiffy with few easily available ingridients.
preparationMethod: Combine the cabbage, onion and green chillies in a bowl, add salt and rub it nicely so that cabbage and onions water is released.
Add the besan slowly mixing it nicely
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the pakodas in hot oil till golden brown.
Serve hot with green chutney or phudina chutney.

recipeDescription: A crunchy and healthful cabbage and paneer salad has finely chopped cabbage and diced paneer tossed together in a a lovely dressing.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves, cabbage, capsicum, paneer, green chillies and saute for 2 minutes.
Remove from the flame, add the salt and lemon juice.
Serve warm.

recipeDescription: Here is a traditional thick soup recipe, the Cabbage Chowder with a delectable hint of chopped celery , cabbage and select seasonings.
preparationMethod: Wash and chop vegetables. all the seeds must be removed from the green pepper and it should be rinsed well before chopping.
Put vegetables in a pan with water, salt and pepper.
Bring to boil and simmer for about 15 min.
Prepare a white sauce with butter and flour and milk.
Add to the veg. mixture.
Add cheese and paprika and stir still cheese has melted.

recipeDescription: A simple, tasty and healthy Cabbage Sandwich with chopped cabbage along with select dressings and seasonings as filling in between the bread slices.
preparationMethod: Mix the two sauces together and keep aside.
Put the sandwich maker on to heat.
Apply the mixed sauce on two slices of bread.
Now spread a little of the the shredded cabbage on one the slices applied with the sauce.
Sprinkle a little cheese on the cabbage and cover with the other slice with sauce.
Now put the prepared bread slices in the sandwich maker and leave till it is done.
Cut it into half and serve hot with tomato and cucumber slices.

recipeDescription: 1. do not over cook the cabbage filling. 2. if required spicy apply green chutney on both the slices. 3. onions are optional and can be added before adding the capsicum.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a pan.
Add capsicum, chilli paste and ginger paste.
Add the cabbage and stir for 3- 4 mins. do not over cook.
Add salt to taste
Add the coriander leaves
Butter two slices of bread and add green chutney on one of the bread.
Put the cabbage filling on the other buttered bread and cover with the chutney slice.
Place the sandwiched bread in a sandwich toaster and let it cook for 5 mins.
Serve hot with green chutney and ketchup.

recipeDescription: A tasty toast sandwich filled with a mix od cabbage,tomatoes, garlic and chillies.
preparationMethod: Chop cabbage very fine,mix some salt &keep aside for 20 minutes.
Apply butter &chuteny on all 2 slices.
Squeeze out water from cabbage.
Add chilly,garlic & tomatto.mix well.
Spread cabbage on one slice of bread cover with other & make toast in equity toaster.
Serve hot with tomatto ketch up & green chutney.

recipeDescription: To keep ginger chilli paste for a long time, grind chopped ginger and green chillies ,adding little vinegar . this can be stored in the fridge for months.
preparationMethod: Mix milkmaid with coconut and keep aside.
Crumble the chocolate cake well and mix in raisins and chopped nuts.
Make small size balls.
Make balls with coconut mixture, press them on the palm ,put the chocolate ball in it and then first give it a round shape and then give it a roll shape.
Put vark ,only on top.
Cover and keep it in the fridge to set.
Cut it into diagonal pieces and serve.

recipeDescription: Cantaloupei.e Musk melon ,Pomegranate and Mint Juice is a perfect blend of summer fruits, refreshing and energizing for the summers. The addition of mint leaves brings in the added freshness and colour to the drink. You could add some liqueurs to this to make a perfect cocktail drink for your summer parties as well. If we peel and cut the Cantaloupe's and store in the refrigerator it becomes easy to make fresh juice more frequently for the kids in the summers.
preparationMethod: puree the pomegranate in the blender and strain to remove any residue. Keep aside.
In the same blender, puree the cantaloupe adding very little water to make a smooth mixture. You can optionally strain the Cantaloupe juice, but can avoid straining to keep the fiber in the juice.
Combine both the pomegranate and the Cantaloupe juice, along with the chopped mint leaves, salt and juice from one lemon and mix well.
Add little crushed ice in each serving glass,pour prepared juice and serve as a refreshing summer drink.

recipeDescription: Your capsi chow is ready in few minutes it is very delicious and very fast
preparationMethod: Boil the noodles and add little oil
Cut capsicum into pieces and add garlic and adding little water puree them (do not add too much of water)
Heat kadai and put oil in it, then put puree in it and saute for 2-3 min
Now add boiled noodles, salt, and other ingrediants and mix well
Your capsi chow is ready in few minutes
It is very delicious and very fast

recipeDescription: Try with parathas and we can use it as a dry curry
preparationMethod: Wash capsicum and cut them into pices of small size.
Cut onions and tomatoes also into pices of the same size as of capsicum
Heat the oil in a pan
Add onion and tomato pieces first. let it fry till it becomes soft.
Now add capsicum and add haldi,mirchi powder,salt and cover with a lid till capsicum becomes soft.
Keep stirring in between
Now add garam masala powder, and dry coconut and serve.
The whole cooking has to be done on a low flame.

recipeDescription: Capsicum masala, a spicy recipe made so easy to prepare ! Add chopped capsicum with a range of Indian spices to prepare a lip smacking capsicum masala recipe.
preparationMethod: Method:
1.place a pan on the stove on medium heat, when hot put the groundnuts & fry without any oil, take care not to turn them black, immediately remove them & set aside.
2. similarly fry till, jeera, methi seeds, dry coconut powder, chopped onions. remember to fry all of them separately.
3. then remove the skin of the groundnuts & place aside.

4. next grind the fried jeera, methi seeds, peeled groundnuts, til, dry coconut powder into a nice powder, then add haldi, chilli powder, garam masala, dhania powder & grind all of them together again. now to this powder add the fried onions, tamarind juice, salt to taste, & gind all of them to make a smooth paste. add water while grinding if requi

5. now place a kadai on a medium hot stove, put oil generously, put a pinch of jeera, then put the masala paste prepared, after a minute put the cut capsicum, mix them gently so that masala evenly spreads to the capsicum pieces & cover the kadai with a lid. keep checking , once the capsicum is cooked , our sizzling simlamirch masala is ready

recipeDescription: Mushrooms and capsicum is a novel combination and accompanied with specific masalas work wonders to our taste buds. Mushroom and capsicum fry is a tasty and colourful dish which can be served with roti or parathas.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a pan, add the onions, green chillies and ginger and saute on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the capiscum, mushroom, chilli powder and salt and saute for 2 to 4 minutes.
Add the tomato sauce and sprinkle little water and simmer for 2 minutes on a medium flame.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Serve it with nice cold juice, as starter, jain people love it in place of onion rings.
preparationMethod: Cut the capsicum in rings, cutting them across the diameter.
On other side, soak maida in water, add salt and pepper and fruit salt eno.
Soak it for 15 minutes and then add more water for batter consistency.
Apply the mustard paste to capscium rings.
Dip the ring in the maida batter and fry it.
Sprinke chat masala on top and serve hot

recipeDescription: An unusual chutney with mild flavors. It goes well with dosa and idli.
preparationMethod: Heat 3 tsp oil in a pan, add the ginger, garlic and cashewnuts and saute till they turn golden brown.
Add the coconut and saute for 2 minutes.
ADd the tomatoes, mix well and saute for 1 minute.
Add the salt, turmeric and chilli powder and mix well.
Cover and cook the tomatoes with about half cup of water.
Once the tomatoes are cooked, cool it and then grind the chutney coarsely.
Heat the remaining oil in a small pan and add the mustard and cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the asafoetida and immediately pour the tempering on the chutney.
Serve with idli or dosa.

recipeDescription: Tread the nostalgic lanes with this easy and quick cauliflower recipe, cauliflower (gobhi) in curry. The curry is prepared with onion-tomato and ginger garlic paste along with Indian spice powders. The cauliflower in curry recipe sans rich masala and overpowering spices. A healthy and tasty vegetarian treat for the entire family.
preparationMethod: Soak cashew nuts in half cup milk for half an hour and the make a fine paste adding the rest half cup of milk.
Puree tomato well by grinding it in a mixer and set aside.
Cut cauliflower in 2 inch big florets. add little salt, turmeric and garam masala powder and set aside for 10 min.

Heat a non-stick pan and add oil. add jeera and allow it to crackle. add the cauliflower florets and let it shallow fry in the oil until light brown. add the rest of the garam masala poeder red chilly powder and turmeric powder.
Add tomato puree. bring the subzi to a boil. add cashew nut paste and let it boil for 1-2 min. add salt to taste.
Switch off the gas and garnish with corriander leaves.

recipeDescription: After making cauliflower curry, i had a small portion left over. So i thought of making some snack item with the remaining cauliflower for a evening munch. I used to prepare onion pakoda before. So i thought of making something similar with cauliflower too.
preparationMethod: Boil the cauliflower in salted water for 7 minutes in a microwave oven.
Drain and add all the ingredients and mix well to make a thick smooth batter.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and drop small balls of mixture and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot.

recipeDescription: It is kind of a simple home-curry. Just the combination of ingredients is quite new!
preparationMethod: Wash and remove stems from cauliflower.
Take out the florets and chop them into small dice-sized pieces.
Clean spinach leaves and chop them nicely.
Heat oil in a big kadhai and add cumin seeds.
Once it crackles, add hing and chopped cauliflower along with some water, salt and turmeric powder.
Let it cook covered for 7-8 mins and then add chopped spinach along with all the spices.
Mix everything well and cook it uncovered for 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Cccc
preparationMethod: Cccc

recipeDescription: Chai alpha from premade complete mix is a sweet milk based beverage recipe. In a sauce pan, heat milk, add the instant mix and whisk it till frothy and creamy.
preparationMethod: In saucepan, heat milk and mix till frothy, constantly slowly stirring with whisk
Serve immediately

recipeName: Chai Alpha From Premade Complete Mix
recipeDescription: Chai alpha from premade complete mix is a tea recipe which is prepared by mixing the ,milk with the premade chai mix and then whisking it till frothy and creamy.
preparationMethod: In saucepan with medium high (4/6) heat, heat milk and mix till frothy, constantly slowly stirring with whisk
Serve immediately
1. pressure cook moong daal, don’t drain water from it.
2. mix together all flours, salt, chilly paste, baking soda, turmeric powder.
3. heat a pan with 4tsp oil.add curry leaves & cumin seeds. once splutter remove it from fire.
4. pour the cooked daal & oil in the mixture.
5. mix it well & make soft dough of it.
6. using chakali maker make chakali & fry them.
7. this light green colored chakali has a very different taste.

recipeDescription: Healthy and fatless, good both for adults and kids. can be served even as breakfast.
preparationMethod: Boil kabuli channa till done and drain. take kabuli channa in a mixing bowl, add chopped onion, green chillies, grated ginger, lemon juice and salt and mix well.garnish with chopped coriander.
Pour hot milk in a bowl and add leftover chapathi pieces and leave it soak for about 10minutes after soaking add all other ingredients and garnish with dry fruits flakes

recipeDescription: Instead of besan you can use egg.
preparationMethod: Mix chopped spinach, chopped onion and grated coconut together.
Add salt green shilli paste to it.
Add besan and water mix all.
Pour the mixed mixture on tava and place the chapathi on top of it and press.
Then reverse the chapathi, and roll them.
Apply butter on top of it and serve

recipeDescription: Dont throw the left over chapities as another receipe for the morning breakfast can be prepared within no time try it
preparationMethod: Crumble the left over chapaties with hand and keep aside
Heat oil in a pan and add to it a little musterd seeds, cumin seeds,finily cut onions tomato and chillis fry till golden brown
After that add the crumbled chapaties and stir well till it is soft
Garnish with coconut and corinder leaves

recipeDescription: Chappati upma is an innovative upma recipe with left over chapattis soaked and then cooked with onion, mustard seeds, curry leaves, lime juice and chopped coriander leaves. An excellent breakfast item, chapatti upma is easy and delicious.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the garlic, green chillis and tomato and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the masalas and tamarind, mix well and saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water, mix well and bring it to boil.
Add the chapatis and simmer for 5 mins.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: A preparation of leftover chappatis cut into noodle like strips tossed with nutritious veggies.
preparationMethod: Cut the left over chapattis into thin strips (like noodles). keep aside.
Heat the oil in the pan, add mustard seed and allow it to splutter.
Add the onion, ginger and green chilli, curry leaves and sauté on a medium flame for 10 minutes or till the onion are cooked.
Add tomatoes and sauté till the oil separates out.
Add chilly powder, coriander powder and gram masala powder and sauté for few minutes
Add the finely cut chapattis into it and sauté for another few minutes
If required add some tomato sauce and again sauté it atleast for 10 minutes or until it blends and chapattis become crisp.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Bhujia chaat is a special chaat recipe with bhujias and sev tossed with sweet and spicy chutneys.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve immediately garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: 1.saute as per your your taste.crunchier the better
preparationMethod: 1.cut karonda into halves.
2.mash chillies (uneven cuts).
3.heat oil add all the masalas add chillis and karonda. saute for 1min
4.its ready to eat.
(it can be accompanied with mathri)

recipeDescription: 1. it is low in calories. 2. secondly sprouted beans contain high proteins so we can count it in healthy food also. you can serve this as starter also. 3. instead of papad you can use monita canapes also.
preparationMethod: 1. roast the urad papad for 30 seconds in microwave.(if you don`t have microwave you can use gas for roast the papad).
2. immediatly after removing from microwave and when it is hot make bowl shape from papad and keep aside.
3. mix all the remaining ingrediants in one bowl, add chat masala and chilly powder and toss it well.
4. now in one plate place papad bowl, in that put some mixture and garnish with some chopped coriander and serve.

recipeDescription: Do not crush idli's. cut them with a knife. it would be easier for frying.
preparationMethod: Cut idli''s to small pieces
Pour oil in a pan
Deep fry idli''s till they turn brown.
Place fried idli''s in a tissue paper. this would absorb excess oil.
Place another pan and add a spoon of oil.
Add curry leaves and allow it to spatter.
Remove curry leaves from the pan
Add ketchup and 5 spoons of water.
Add fried idli''s in the pan.
Transfer them to a plate and decorate with the curry leaves.
Serve hot

recipeDescription: A simple and tasty Check sandwich recipe with mayonnaise, butter and grated cheese as the delectable bread spread.
preparationMethod: Mix all given ingredients together and prepare a smooth paste.
Apply these paste on slice and arrange them in alternate order.
Now cut all the slice together into 3 blocks.
Turn the centre block upside down.apply remaining paste on both sides of centre block and then stick all three together.
Cover this block in a wet thin cloth and keep in fridge to chill.

recipeDescription: Slice the cucumber very thin for best results.
preparationMethod: Slightly toast the bread slices on a tava with butter till light brown.
Spread the cheese on both the slices evenly.
Sprinkle the pepper on the bread.
Spread 5 slices of the cucumber on one slice.
Sprinkle pepper on the cucumber.
Do the same for the other slice of bread.
Sandwich them and serve.

ingredients: slices of bread (white or brown bread)
recipeDescription: Mozzarella cheese and capsicum together tastes good along with the hint of green chilli.
preparationMethod: Remove the sides of bread with cutter.
On one side of 2 slices spread the butter evenly.
On one side of other 2 slices, spread green chutney evenly and all slices keep aside
Mix grated cheese, chopped capsicum, chopped green chilli and salt.
Divide the mix in equal two portions.
Put and spread the cheese-capcicum mix on both the buttered slices.
Put the slice with chutney on top of that and press it lightly.
Divide the sandwich diagonally in two halves and serve.

recipeDescription: The yummy cheese balls are a popular cheesy snack item which is a favorite among children. The grated cheesen is mixed with chillies, salt and other seasoning and shaped into balls. These cheese balls are then deep fried and served with coriander chutney.
preparationMethod: Mix all the ingredients very well with little water to make a dough.
Make small balls.
Deep fry till golden brown.
Serve with tomato ketchup

recipeDescription: This is an amazing easy and equally quick prepared dish for everyone at any time .this can be served for guest and for children and everybody.
preparationMethod: Cut the bread slices into 4 pieces and aside.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle add the onions, tomatoes and capsicum.
Cook for a few minutes, add the chilli powder,turmeric powder and salt.
Add the bread pieces and grated cheese, mix well.
Sere immediately.

recipeDescription: This dish can be served as a delicious evening snack and its eye catching looks make it more suitable for serving to guests.
preparationMethod: Take bread slice and cut it in round shape using a bread cutter.
Spread 1 tbsp butter on the bread slices followed by 1 tbsp tomato ketchup over it.
Sprinkle the tomato and capsicum evenly.
Cover with cheese and sprinkle some pepper and salt.
Similarly prepare more 5 open sandwiches using remaining bread slices and ingredients.
Bake in a pre-heated oven at 180 degree Celsius for 3-4 minutes.
Serve hot.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch) powder
recipeDescription: A hybrid between.. cheese chilli veg, bread rolls and pakoras.. cheese chilli pakoras have been my proud creations for some time now
preparationMethod: Finely chop capsicum and onion in a chopper and squeeze out as much water as you can.
In a bowl mix chopped vegetables, cheese spread, mayonnaise, salt, pepper powder and chilli powder and mix well.
Cut the edges and soak the bread slices in milk and squeeze out excess milk.
Fill the mixture and roll just like bread pakoras.
Make sure to fill in small amounts so that the optimum size and flavour is maintained.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, dip the balls in batter and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Cheese Chilly and Capsicum Sandwich, a quick spicy and cheesy sandwich toasted til golden and crisp, is sure to satiate you in a tasteful way when you are oh-so-hungry!
preparationMethod: Take a bowl put one tbsp of cheese spread ,add 1 tsp of chilli paste,salt and black pepper.
Then put this mix on slice of the bread then put the another slice on it.
Take a non stick tava put one tbsp of butter on it and grill it on both the sides till golden brown in colour.
Cut into 4 pieces and serve.

recipeDescription: Bread baked in oven with good amount of butter, flavour of garlic, heat of chilly and over loaded mozzarella cheese.
preparationMethod: Preheat oven to 180-200 celcius
Take a bowl and mix butter, garlic paste, coriander/parsley.
Take a french loaf and slightly grease them with plain butter from all sides.
Cut it from middle (slit its thickness into two), separate both parts and spread our butter-garlic mixture over both parts and bake them into oven for about 5 minutes.
Take the bread out and first add chillies, sprinkle oregano powder.
Add mozzarella cheese on top (add lots of cheese) and bake again for 5 to 10 min or until u see the edges turning brown/change its color.
Take it out and cut into pieces, sprinkle some pepper/oregano.
Serve hot with tomato sauce.

recipeDescription: Cheese chilly toast is a popular toast recipe with grated cheese as filling and chilli sauce as spread. Enjoy the toast as breakfast or packed tiffin with salads.
preparationMethod: Mix grated cheese and chopped simla mirch.
Take 2 bread slices and apply 1/2 tsp chilly sauce to both slices.
Put 1/2 cheese simla mixture on 1 slice and keep another slice on mixture top.
Heat toaster and apply butter on 1 side and keep the sandwich on buttered side and apply little butter on top side of sandwich and close the toaster.
Heat on both the side of toaster for 1 minute.
Serve hot with chilly and tomato sauce.

recipeDescription: Cheese Crackers, these melt in mouth crackers are full of taste and cheesy. You can store and enjoy anytime , are also good to make and store and serve when unexpected guests arrive.
preparationMethod: Preheat oven to 160°c (320°f). Grease baking sheet or line with butter paper.
Combine flour, salt, pepper powder and a pinch of baking powder and mix well.
Combine softened butter, shredded cheese and the dry ingredients mixture in a mixer or food processor and pulse until it turns into coarse crumbs.
Add milk and Pulse once or twice. Take the mixture out in a plate and knead like a dough.
Make lemon size balls from the dough and roll out dough to 1/8" thick. Try to roll into rectangle shape.
Now cut dough into one inch squares using a pizza or pasty cutter.
Transfer the crackers into prepared baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until edges start to brown. Do not over cook. Let them cool completely on a wire rack.
After cooling you can store them in airtight container for up to 3 to 4 days.
1. cut the bread slices into four triangles each.
2. place on a tawa to roast on medium flame.
When both the sides are crisp, put a spoonful of mixture of cheese and vegetables on it.
3. sprinkle some salt and pepper on it and put it back on the tawa to cook on slow flame.
4. cover it with a lid.
5. when the cheese melts remove from the tawa and put a dot of tomato sauce and a decorate with a mint leaf before serving.
Your non-fried cheese crispies are ready in a jiffy for your cocktail party!kids love them too.

recipeDescription: Easy and yummy bread toasted and covered with lots of cheese. A tasty snack.
preparationMethod: Mix all the veg.and cheese together along with salt
Toast the bread on one side
Spread butter on other side
Now spread the cheese mix over the butter side of bread
Grill it till cheese melts and browns.
Serve hot with tomato sauceh

recipeDescription: A popular cheesy bread based snack and kid's favorite cheese toast is an easy and quick recipe to prepare cheese toasts. The delicious cheese toasts melt in the mouth and are loved by all.
preparationMethod: Toast the bread on one side
Put grate cheese on the other slice of toast
Put the onion and tomatoe on the top of the cheese
Serve with tomatoe ketchup or tabasco.
Than cook it for few minutes
This is your cheese toast

recipeDescription: A healthy breakfast recipe of toasted bread with toppings if onion and mushroom covered with a layer of cheese.
preparationMethod: Toast the bread slices (optional).
Heat the oil. lightly fry the vegetables and mushrooms.
Add salt. spread the vegetable mix over the bread slice and top it with grated cheese.
Melt cheese in the oven and serve the mushroom toasts.

recipeDescription: Try this recipe exclusively for children when you think of giving them something cheesy, healthy and tasty. Simple ingredients bound together and baked. A perfect snack for short break.
preparationMethod: Mix all the above ingredients in a bowl and add tsp by tsp of chilled water for binding medium soft dough.
Make balls of the dough and give a depression with your thumb in the centre.
Arrange the cookies on a baking tray and bake in a preheated oven at 150 c for 10-12 minutes.
Store in an air tight container.

recipeDescription: Get ready to taste the Cheesy bread balls with mint chutney as a crispy fried cheesy snack. The breads are soaked and made into ball along with spices and then stuffed with grated cheese before deep frying. An excellent snack which is going to be a super hit among the children.
preparationMethod: Soak the bread in water for a minute, squeeze out the water & add
All the ingredients except cheese & mix well . take a small quantity
Of the mixture, shape it into a ball then press between your palms &
Place little cheese ,then shape it into a ball .
Make similiar balls using the remaining mixture .
Deep fry them , cut into half ,a drop of tomato sauce in the centre.
Serve .

recipeDescription: Cheesy capsicum toast is a cheesy sandwich recipe with finely chopped capsicum sprinkled over with grated cheese as filling. Enjoy the toast with green pudina chutney or chilli sauce as breakfast.
preparationMethod: Cut the crusts of the bread and keep aside.
Fry the onions, capsicum and green chillies in oil and add salt and pepper.
Allow the mixture to cool.
Mix the grated cheese to the mixture.
Spread butter on a slice and take a spoonful of the vegetable mixture and spread it evenly on the bread.
Cover it with another slice.
Toast the sandwiches in a sandwich toaster.
Serve it hot with tomato ketchup.

recipeDescription: Cheesy cheez is a simple bread toast recipe with cream , grated cheese, coriander leaves and chillies as filling. The bread slices are filled with the spicy mix and then baked till crispy and golden in color.
preparationMethod: Cut bread slices into shapes as desired.
Mix all ingredients except bread!
Spread the mixture over the bread & bake for 5 minutes.

recipeDescription: This is a very simple recipe. It can be made in minutes.
preparationMethod: Take the paneer and cut it into thin strips.
Cut them into half about 1 inch.
Take the frying pan and add 2 tbsp cooking oil and let it heat.
Put the paneer cut into strips as much as possible in the frying pan.
Roast it till the paneer become golden or light brown.
Add chilli powder, salt and chilli flakes and roast it too.
Now set it in a plate and garnish it with cheese as much as you want.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: Macaroni in cheesy white sauce..
preparationMethod: Heat the butter in a non-stick pan, add the plain flour and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the milk, while stirring continuously so that no lumps are formed and cook for 2 minutes.
add the cheese, mix well and cook till the mixture becomes thick, smooth and saucy.
Add the salt and pepper and mix well. Keep aside.
Heat some butter in another pan, add the macaroni and saute for 3 minutes.
Place the macaroni in a greased oven proof dish and pour the sauce on top.
Sprinkle some more cheese and bake till the cheese melts and turns golden brown.
Serve hot garnished with parsley.

recipeDescription: A cheesy snack prepared in advance for Diwali. It is handy as can be cooked and kept in airtight container anywhere in the house.
preparationMethod: Mix all the dry ingredients first for dough.
Bring it to bread crumb consistency.
Now add wet ingredients and knead a dough.
Cover the dough with muslin cloth and keep it aside for 30 mins
Now heat oil in a wok for frying.
Roll the dough and cut desired shapes.
Leave the namakpars in oil and fry on medium flame till it is cooked well and crisp.
Cool it down and store in a airtight container

recipeDescription: Yummy cheese dip, inspired a bit by dominos cheese dip. Very easy to make, a must try for cheese-lovers!!!!
preparationMethod: Grate 5 cheese cubes and keep aside.
Heat the non - stick pan and melt butter in it.
Add oregano and garlic paste.
Now add grated cheese cubes and milk together and stir well.
Add salt and cook till the batter is thick and no lumps are left.
Serve with grilled garlic bread or nachos.
Put it in an air-tight container and use as required.

recipeDescription: Be careful with the salt quantity as cheese too contains salt.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a wok or karahi.
Saute onion on a high heat for 2 min.
Add capsicum and saute for 2 min.
Add tomato and saute for few more mins
Add tomato ketchup and season as per taste.
Take off from heat.
Now lightly heat the tortillas or chapatis from both sides,brush with butter.
Fill each tortilla with the above mixture spread grated cheese over it.
Wrap and seal with toothpick.
And grill till cheese is melted and tortilla is crisp or heat on tava from both the sides.
Now cut in to the pieces and serve hot with tea or fresh juice.

recipeDescription: This is a quick recipe. very good breakfast. very effective when suffering from cold and cough.
preparationMethod: Mix well besan, salt and red chillies.
Add ginger, green chilly, and onion paste and egg to above to form a consistent paste.
Put some butter on tava( not required on non stick tava)
Put the mixture and cook till light brown.

recipeDescription: It can be made crispy by spreading Marie biscuit crumbs on it (before spreading cheese)
preparationMethod: Make a slightly thick batter of maida,sooji and besan and add salt and red chilli powder to it.
Keep aside the batter for 8 - 10 minutes.
Heat the tawa.apply little oil on it.
Dip 1 slice of bread in the batter and put it on the tawa.
On the top ,uncooked side of the bread, spread chopped onion tomato and corriander.
Spread kali mirch.
Keep applying oil on the bread.press on top a little.
Now turn it upside down and let the other side cook and turn brown.
When both the sides are done,bring it down from the tawa and spread cheese on top.
Serve with tomato and chilli sauce.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: An innovative recipe where famous and all time favourite chilli paneer is stuffed between buns to give it a twist..
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a kadhai and deep fry paneer pieces till they turn golden brown from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and keep aside.
Heat 4 tbsp of oil in a pan, add green chillies, dry red chillies ,garlic and ginger and saute for a minute.
Add the onions and saute till golden brown.
Add capsicum and saute for few minutes, making sure they don't turn very soft.
Add all the sauces and mix well.
Add the fried paneer and boiled pasta and cook on low fflame for 2 minutes.
Keep aside.
Cut the buns into 2 pieces.
Heat a tava and sprinkle some chilli powder on it and then just brush the bun for 30 seconds.
Do same for all the buns.
Put the cooked paneer mixture in the middle of two buns.
Serve hot.

recipeName: Chilled caribbean tender coconut and watermelon
ingredients: coconut, scoop out the meat (nariyal ki malai)
watermelon (tarbuj), deseeded and cut into cubes
recipeDescription: Passion fruit juice can be substituted for grapefruit juice and fresh basil for mint
preparationMethod: Mix together all the ingredeints,except mint,and chill.
Garnish with mint and serve

recipeDescription: Cook up breakfasts within minutes with this popular and simple chilli- cheese toast recipe.Simply apply cheese and chilli sauce over the bread slices and bake it to crispy finish in a preheated oven.
preparationMethod: Preheat oven to 400 f.cut capsium without seeds to small pieces ., mix all the above ingredients ., spread on the bread slices and bake for 10 -15 mts., remove cut into triangles and serve hot with tomato ketchup.

recipeDescription: A filling breakfast that keeps u energized
preparationMethod: Filling
Mix finely chopped capsicum, onion, green chillie and grated cheese and add pepper and salt to in.
Stuff this filling between two bread slices
Apply butter on external sides of bread and roast till cheese melts
Serve hot with tamatoe sauce.

recipeDescription: Start your day with tasty and healthy Chilly cheese toast. The cheese spread and the chilli sauce add a delectable hot cheesy taste to the bread slices and is best suited for breakfasts or evening snacks.
preparationMethod: Chop the onions, capsicum and green chillies finely.
Saute the onions in the oil till transparent.
Now, add the salt, green chillies and the capsicum pieces also and saute till done.
Do not overcook the capsicum as it''s flavour is best when lightly cooked.
Add the cheese to the vegetables and stir continuously till it melts and forms a paste.
Divide the above vegetable paste to six equal portions.
Apply butter on one side of each slice and the vegetable paste on the other side. spread the paste evenly on the bread slice.
Toast on tava or snack toaster (with the buttered side downwards) till done.
Serve hot with tomato ketchup.
chop french beans and boil them. mix them and add soya sauce and chili sauce. mix well.
In a frying pan heat oil and roast finely chopped spring with leaves for 5 minutes and add noodles and vegetables. mix well.
Make dosa and put chinese vegetable in the center and fold and serve warm

ingredients: few strands of spring onion greens
recipeDescription: Famous egg bhurji with a chinese twist by adding ajinomoto and soya sauce with different vegetables.
preparationMethod: Beat eggs and keep it aside.
Heat oil in a wok.
Add galic,ginger and chillies stir for 2 mins.
Saute capsicum in it for 3-5 minutes.
Add soyasauce,salt and ajinamoto.
Add the beaten egg in it.
Cook till the egg is cooked.
Garnish it with spring onions.

recipeDescription: A delicious Chinese starter..
preparationMethod: Combine the flour and butter and mix well using your palms, till the mixture resembles bread crumbs.
Add the cheese, mix well and knead into a soft dough using chilled water.
Roll our the dough, using little plain flour, into a 1/4" thick rectangular shape.
Keep aside.
Combine the cauliflower, coriander, onion, chillies and white sauce in a bowl and mix well.
Add salt, mix well and spread this mixture evenly on the dough.
Roll the dough from one side and seal from the end.
Wrap in butter paper and keep in the refrigerator for half an hour.
Cut into round slices of 1/2" thickness. and place them on a flat greased baking tray.
Bake in a pre-heated oven at 375°C for 20 minutes or till it turns golden browna nd crisp.
Cool and serve.

recipeName: Chinese Style Bread Noodles in Soya and Tomato Sauce
recipeDescription: This comforting and reliable classic features bread,vegetables cooked in Soya and Tomato Sauce. It's just delicious!
preparationMethod: Dip the bread slices in water squeeze and mash them well.
Pass them through chakli press and press out small balls of the mixture into idli moulds.
Steam using steamer for 5 to 7 minutes.
Allow them to cool.
Heat the oil in a pan or a kadhai and add the green chilli paste and saute for 30 seconds.
Add the mixed vegetables and m.s.g and saute ona high flame for few minutes.
Add salt , mix well and add the bread noodles to the vegetables and saute for a few minutes
Add the soya sauce and tomato ketchup and mix well.
Remove from the flame and serve hot.
