Apply a portion of the mixture on a bread slices and spread it evenly covering the bread completely.
Spread little mozzarella cheese and 2 or 3 wedges of cherry tomatoes.
Sprinkle little black pepper and sesame seeds on top.
Bake in a hot oven at 300 degree Celsius for 7-8 minutes or till the cheese has melted and is slightly brown on top depending on your taste.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle some chopped basil/ mint on top.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: good for skin and u can keep this paste in your fridge up to 2-3 days.
preparationMethod: mix all the ingridents , apply on ur face daily ,massage it well on ur face,hand,neck and leg and wash ur face with warm water.

ingredients: salt, poppy seeds (khus-khus), caraway seeds (shahjeera) sesame seeds (til)
recipeDescription: These pretzels taste best when eaten on the day they are made. if you are going to store them, they may be wrapped in foil and reheated in the oven at 325 degrees.
preparationMethod: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees and prepare 2 sheet pans with parchment paper.

Combine the water, yeast and honey in a small bowl and let stand for five minutes, until yeast is dissolved and has proofed (you''ll notice tiny bubbles forming on the top of the water). in a large bowl, combine flour and salt. add the water/yeast mixture to the flour slowly and stir until a dough begins to form.

Turn the dough out onto a clean work surface and knead for 5-7 minutes or until the dough is smooth and elastic. divide the dough into 4 and then divide each of the smaller pieces into 4. you should have now 16 pieces! roll each piece into a “snake” and form into different shapes. you could try a classic pretzel shape, a knot, a letter or an animal
With a pastry brush, lightly apply the beaten egg to the pretzels (not so much that the egg drips down the sides). this will make them shiny and golden when baked.
Bake a 425 degrees for 17-20 minutes, or until pretzels are golden brown.

recipeDescription: Solkadhi or Kokam Kadhi is a refreshing digestive drink prepared in the coastal regions of Maharashtra and Goa. It is anti-inflammatory and is a great remedy for acidity. The drink must be served cold.
preparationMethod: Heat the ghee in a kadhai and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the green chillies and garlic and saute till it turns golden brown.
Add the coconut milk, mix well and bring to boil.
Add the kokum syrup, mix well till everything is dissolved.
Add salt and don't allow the mixture to boil.
When it is hot enough and turns pink turn off the flame.
Let it cool down and then refrigerate for a minimum of 2-3 hours.
While serving strain it and serve.

recipeDescription: Cut the lady's finger into two. to cut it easily..
preparationMethod: Wash the lady's fingers.
Cut long strips of the outer green skin only.
Cut the vegetable so as to leave behind the seeds.
Cut all in the same pattern, and try to cut them in thin strips.
Now when all is done, put some oil and fry them in it.
See that it remains cripsy, but doesn't burn.
Then serve in a plate with salt-redchillypowder or chat masala or black salt sprinkled on it.
Cut the tomato in a flower-shape.
Decorate it with cabbage around and tomato in the middle.
Serve:with soups,as starters,snacks.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: This is an off-beat with veggies roasted on skewers!
preparationMethod: Heat 1/2 tsp oil in a pan and dry roast the semolina till it turns light pink in colour.
Remove and heat the remaining oil in the same pan, add the green chillies and saute for 30 seconds.
Meanwhile, bring 1 3/4 cup water to boil along with salt.
Add the semolina to the pan and the boiling water and cook for 5 minutes, stirring continuously.
Keep aside.
Arrange the vegetables alternatively in a skewer and sprinkle some salt and pepper.
Drizzle some oil and grill in a griller till it turns crisp.
Arrange the upma in a serving plate along with the vegetables skewers.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: Very good with khubuz (arabic bread) and fresh or grilled vegetables.
preparationMethod: Chop gariic and green chili in a food processor.
Add sour cream and salt.
Make to a smooth paste.
Remove to a bowl and mix chopped parsley leaves.

recipeDescription: Edible calcium paste is helpful for daily dose of calcium needs, paan leaf and betel nuts helps in digestion. coconut is to impart a mild sweet taste.
preparationMethod: Wash the leaves properly and dry them. apply a bit of the edible calcium paste on the centre of the leaf with finger, put little betel nut and top with dessicated coconut. fold the leaf into pan shape and seal with a clove. serve.

recipeDescription: Brinjal sambhar is a traditional south indian recipe with roasted or boiled brinjals mashed and then cooked with onion, tamarind pulp and ground coconut paste.
preparationMethod: Boil the brinjals with a pinch of turmeric, green chillies, and tomatoes in a deep pan, till they turn soft.
Drain the excess water and mash the brinjal nicely.
Add the salt, tamarind pulp and coconut, mix well and simmer till the mixture becomes thick,
Remove form the flame and keep aside.
For the tempering, heat the oil in a small pan and add the mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves and dry chillies and saute till the seeds crackle.
Pour this tempering on the brinjals and mix well.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: Southy noodles is one of the most interesting fusion recipes. The boiled noodles are cooked in typical traditional South Indian style of cooking with mustard seeds, curry leaves, grated coconut and red chillies.
preparationMethod: Heat a pan and add the butter in it
Now put the sarson seeds in it till they start cracking.
Remove the pan from the gas and put water in it,bring it to boil and then add salt,haldi,red chilli powder.
Now add noodles and cook them till they are about to be completely done.
Finally add the vinegar in it and mix it well,and remove it from the gas.
Your southy noodles are ready to eat.

recipeDescription: Add Soy - koftas in your main course fare to reap the rich taste and good health benefits of soya beans. The soya granules are made into fried koftad or dumplings and then simmered in an onion tomato based mouthwatering cutty.
preparationMethod: For koftas:
Heat oil in a pan.
Add the bottle gourd, chilli powder,turmeric and salt.
Close lid and cook for 5 min.
Add the soya flour and toss for 3-4 min.
When cool shape into small round balls.
Deep fry till golden brown.
For gravy:
Heat oil in a pan .
Saute the onions till golden brown.
Add tomatoes and all powders and salt.
Saute for 4-5 min.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Add the koftas and leave it on low heat for 5 min.
Garnish with coirander.
Mix all the ingr. in a grinder and blend it, serve in glass

recipeDescription: Soya bean bhaji or nutrela, soya chunks based subji serve with roti or with plain parathas.
preparationMethod: Soak the soya chunk in warm water for 10 minutes and give one boil to the chunks, remove from warm water and squeeze it thoroughly and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, add the onions, green chillies, saute till the onion turns to golden brown.
Add the soya chunks, tomatoes, all dry masalas and salt, mix well and saute for 5 minutes on medium flame.
Add 2 cups water and simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve hot garnish with coriander.

recipeDescription: Soya bean burji is an innovative burji or crumbled up vegetable recipe with the soaked soybeans ground into a paste and then cooked with onion, chillies, spices and tomatoes.
preparationMethod: Chop onions, tomatoes, green chilies and coriander leaves to small pieces.
Soak soya beans in water for 3-4 hrs. grind the soaked soya beans in mixer grinder to a thin paste adding little water.
Add chopped onions, tomatoes, chilies, coriander leaves and salt to taste. mix well.
Take 2-3 tea spoon oil in a frying pan. when the pan heats up, put the above mixture and stir till the paste thickens. keep stirring until the mixture solidifies and turns light brown.
Decorate with coriander leaves and pepper powder
And serve

recipeDescription: Soyabean curry or Nutrela is a delectable vegetable dish prepared from soybean. Soyabean curry is a great way of adding protein to your diet. Try this simple and delicious Soyabean or nutrela bhaji recipe.
preparationMethod: First pressure cook soked soyabeans, remove from fire after 3 pressures. take a kadai, pour oil in it, after it is heated on a medium flame, put rai,jeera,red chillies(optional).after they splutter,add hing,methi powder, then add chopped onion.saute till onion is well cooked, then add dhania powder,turmeric powder,chillie powder and salt. mix well

recipeName: Soya Beans Open Sandwich Using Pizza Base
recipeDescription: Its a open sandwich prepare with healthy soya beans on pizza base toast.
preparationMethod: Heat oil add cumin , when start spluttering, add chooped onion .Cook till translucent.
Add turmeric, green chilli, red chilli sauce.Cook 30sec then add beans and mix well.
Add chaat masala, tomatoes and adjust salt as required.
Cook till beans become dry consistency. Keep aside
Take pizza base , cut into small size round shape with the help of round cutter .
Now heat butter on nonstick tava, put the pizza base round shape pieces. crisp from one side .
Now take from tawa , on crispy side, apply tomato ketchup, put 1 tbsp of beans and grated cheese on each pieces.
Then again heat butter on tava and place this open beans sandwich on it.cook for 2min till base crisp and cheese melt.
Serve and enjoy.

recipeDescription: This recipe is a great combination of green paste and soya granules
preparationMethod: Grind together coriander, mint, green chilies, garlic and keep aside.
In a bowl, take boiled soya granules, besan, green paste, salt, chilli powder, soya sauce and mix well, adding some water if required.
Heat oil in a kadhai, make small pakodas of the soya mixture and deep fry on medium flame till crisp and golden brown.
Serve hot with green chutney or tomato ketchup.

recipeDescription: Soya curry is a delectable vegetable dish prepared from soybean. Soya curry is a great way of adding protein to your diet. Try this simple and delicious soya curry recipe.
preparationMethod: Boil the soya and cut the soya cut the onion crunch the ginger and garlic.
Take one pan put some oil first you put some mustard.
Then onion to fry little brown.
Then add soya just 2min to fry and then add turmeric powder,paste of masala, red chilli powderand salt. and little more oil.

recipeDescription: Prepare the soft and delicious Soya idlis for breakfast and bring a variation to the staple bread butter breakfast menu. The soya idlis are low fat, healthy and packded with proteins and other vital nutrients.
preparationMethod: Soak soya beans for 8 hours.grind with a pinch of jeera and add bombay rawa.mix to the consistency of idly dough.add salt and make idlis.enjoy with coconut chutney.for a variation you may add a piece of ginger while grinding the soya beans

recipeDescription: North indian special. . . Soya kebabs!
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl, mix well and keep aside for 30-40 minutes.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and make kebabs of each portion.
Heat the oil in kadhai and deep fry each kebab till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides.
Serve hot garnished with coriander leaves, chaat masala and lemon juice.

recipeDescription: A healthful chapatti recipe, Soya mince chatpati chapatti is prepared by filing in soaked soya granules into samosa patties and then shallow fried. Enjoy the soya mince chapatti with green chutney or aloo curry.
preparationMethod: 1) boil soya mince water and dry thoroughly. add all remaining ingredients for filling and keep aside
2) prepare stiff dough by mixing ingridents for outer covering. divide into 10 portions
3) roll out one portion on well greased surface, into an extremely thin chapti af about 15inches diameter.
4) place a samosa chapati on big chapati, spread 3 tablespoon of filling on top and fold chapati from all sides into rectangle, enveloping filling.
5) shallow fry chapati over low heat, until golden and crisp.
6) serve with salad, red chilli chutney and tamarind chutney

recipeDescription: Take only limited quantity. make fresh dough don't use carry overs.
preparationMethod: Sieve soya & bengal gram flour togather.
Put salt , ghee into it.
Make it a dough.
Take a kadai & pour the oil into that
Take a murukku preesser fill it up with lemon size amount of the dough.
Now press that above the boiling oil.
Now tasty murukku is ready !!

recipeDescription: Serve the crispy deep fried Soya pakora, made from dipping the soya chunks in a spicy batter mix with sweet and sour chutney or sauces.
preparationMethod: Soak the soya chunks for 10-15 mins and squeeze out
Mix besan, haldi, salt, soda and ginger-green chilli paste using water to a bater of thick pouring consistency
Dip drained soya chunks one by one in the batter and deep fry in hot oil till golden brown. serve hot with sweet and sour chutney or tomato sauce.

recipeDescription: A protein rich vegetable preparation made with combination of paneer and soya flavoured with other vegetables as well.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients, mix well and knead into a soft dough.
Cover with a wet muslin cloth and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a broad pan, add the ginger and garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Add the onions and saute till they turn golden brown.
Add all the remaining vegetables and saute they turn soft.
Add the soya granules and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the sauces, mix well and cook for 1 more minute.
Remove from the flame and add the paneer and cheese and mix well.
Add the salt and mix well.
Divide the dough into small equal portions and roll them into circles of 4" diameter.
Place a portion of the stuffing at the center and bring the sides together to seal the edges.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry till they turn golden brown form all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Simply blend the soaked soyabeans with gram flour and make a paste to create this delectable Soyabean ke pakode. The thick batter is deep fried in hot oil and relished crispy hot with chutney or sauce as snack or starter.
preparationMethod: Wash and soak soyabean for 6-8 hours
Drain water and make a stiff paste
Add gram flour to it
Add all remaining ingredients
Fry till golden brown in hot oil on medium fire.

recipeDescription: Mathris are deep fried flat breads recipe and this Soyabean ki mathri brings out a nice variation by adding soya flour to the maida or refined flour based dough mix.Add ajwain and oil to impart that crispy and flavoured taste.
preparationMethod: Mix maida and soya flour
Add 100gms oil to it and mix well
Add salt and ajwain
Add water and make a hard dough
Make small balls out of dough
Roll out mathri
Prick these mathri with fork
Fry on medium-low heat till golden

recipeDescription: More garam masala can be added if required more spicy. Can be served as starters with drinks.
preparationMethod: In a big bowl take water and soak soyabean chunks for 15 minutes. squeeze out all the water and cut the chunks into four pieces.
Take oil in a kadai. when oil is hot, add onions and fry till brown.
Add cut tomatoes and slit green chillies.
Fry for 1 minute.
Add turmeric powder, chilli powder, garam masala powder and salt and stir.
Add 1 cup water and bring to a boil.
Add soyabean chunks and simmer for a few minutes till it absorbs the gravy.
Add coriander leaves as garnish.

recipeDescription: Soyabean vada is a novel recipe of creating savory crispy balls (vadas) from protein dense soybeans. Enjoy delicious soya bean vada with spicy tomato chutney or green coriander chutney.
preparationMethod: Drain the extra water from the soyabeans, wash again and blend in a mixer, adding water only if required.
Add the remaining ingredients and blend again till smooth.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, use your wet palms to give the shape of wadas and deep fry them till golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Serve hot with hot and sweet coriander chutney or coconut chutney or tomato ketchup.

recipeDescription: An innovative Soyabean based snack item, Soyabean wheels are prepared from stuffing in the cooked Soyabean into dough roll. These stuffed Soyabean rolls are then cut into slices just like wheels and deep fried.
preparationMethod: Soak soybeans overnight and remove the skin and grind coarsely.
Heat 1 tsp of fat and fry the ground soybeans till golden brown in color.
Add spices and remove.
Add one 1tsp of fat to maida and make a hard dough using water.
Roll the dough into 1/8 inch thickness.
Spread the soyabean mixture over this and shape into a roll.
Keep the roll in the fridge for sometime and then cut into ¼ inch thickness with a sharp knife.
Fry the wheels in moderately hot fat till golden brown.

recipeDescription: Spaghetti balls is a novel cutlet or patties recipe with boiled spaghetti mixed with spice powders and then made into a ball. These spaghetti balls are the deep fried till crispy brown and enjoyed as starter or snack.
preparationMethod: Melt the butter in a thick vessel
Add 5tbsps of flour and cook for 5mins
Add the milk and continue stirring until mixture becomes lump
Allow it to cool.
Add the spagetti,coriander,green chillies,celery,salt and cheese
Mix well and shape into round balls
Mix half teacup of flour and 3/4 teacup of water and make a pase
Dip the balls in the paste
Roll theballs in bread crumbs and deep fry
Serve with tomato ketchup

ingredients: bunch of spinach (palak), chopped into big pieces
recipeDescription: Spinach sev is prepared by putting a handful of the spinach puree added sev dough into the sev mould and then deep fried. These crispy crunchy green colored spinach or palak sev is flavored with salt and spice powders and taste amazing as evening snack.
preparationMethod: Steam spinach without water for 3mins.
Blend in a mixer to a smooth paste.
Mix spinach with the remaining ingredients, except oil to a smooth dough.
Knead well. add a little water if required. put a handful of the dough into sev mould and press out sev directly into the hot oil in the kadai.
Fry rill done on bothe side.
Remove from oil.
Store in an airtight container.

recipeDescription: A very convenient to prepare and serve with cocktails and other drinks as you can serve this dish without plates.
preparationMethod: Cut the paneer into rectangular pieces of 1/2" long and keep aside.
Combine the salt, red chilli powder, coriander seeds powder, garam masala and besan batter and mix well to make a thin batter.
Take a piece of paneer and roll the leaf of palak around it and put a tooth pick(wooden) through the mid of the leaf so that the pieces of paneer is fixed.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, dip all the pieces in batter and deep fry for less than half a minute.
Sprinkle chaat-masala on the top and serve hot with spicy chutney.

recipeDescription: Its a popular rajma dish.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai,add onions, red chilli and saute on a medium flame for 2-3 minutes.
Add the ginger-garlic paste, mix well and saute for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes, chilli powder, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the rajma, salt and 1 cup water and cook on a medium flame for 4-5 minutes.
Add the garam masala, mix well and simmer for 2 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipeName: Spice Cabbage Seasoned with Tofu and Red/green Capsicum
recipeDescription: Nice crunchy stir fry preparation which is easy and quick to make.
preparationMethod: In a non-stick pan heat the oil, add cumin seeds and fry for few seconds.
Add the tofu, mix well and cook for 3 minutes,
Add the cabbage and capsicum, all the spices and salt, stir-fry for 3 minutes on the slow flame. Cabbage and capsicum should be crunchy.
Serve warm garnish with coriander.

recipeDescription: Spicy bread offers a novel recipe to prepare bread toasts in jiffy for the school returned hungry kids. The spicy bread is enjoyed with grated cheese as topping and ketchup as dip.
preparationMethod: Cut the bread pieces into small cubes.
Take oil in a fry pan
Add chopped onions and fry till golden brown.
Add the bread pieces, salt, chilli powder, soy sauce and mix well .
Allow to cook for 5 mins.
Serve hot

recipeDescription: a nutritious and healthy breakfast without fat, preferably taken with any fruit juice.
preparationMethod: Clean, wash and soak the dates and red chillies speperately in water for 10 to 15 minutes.
Remove and squeeze out the excess water.
combine the dates and chillies and blend in a mixer along with salt adding enough coconut water till smooth. Keep aside.
Heat a tava and dry roast the sesame seeds till brown.
Cool and blend in a mixer to a smooth powder. Keep aside.
In the same tava, lightly toast the bread without any oil.
Spread the ground paste evenly on one side for 4 bread slices and sprinkle sesame powder on top.
Cover with bread slices and serve immediately.

recipeDescription: Prepare the Spicy garlic chutney and relish it as a spread, dip or chutney with meals. The garlic flavoured spicy chutney is sure to tingle your taste buds when served with any fried or grilled snack or starter.
preparationMethod: Grind together all the ingredients to a fine paste.
In pan take 2 to 3 table spoon of oil and then cook the paste nicely until the oil seperates.
Cool it and keep it in a small glass bottle.

recipeDescription: A delicious spicy green coloured soup!! Simply delicious!
preparationMethod: Combine the beans with tomatoes and ginger in a pressure cooked, add 2-3 cups of water, mix well and pressure cook till cooked.
Cool slightly and blend using a hand blender till smooth. Keep aside.
Heat a non-stick pan, add the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for half a minute.
Add the turmeric powder, coriander, curry leaves and green chillies and roast for few minutes.
Add this to the soups and mix well and bring to boil.
Add the salt and mix well.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: When you chill it overnight , the sour cream gets soaked in masala and catches the taste of the veggies and masala very well.
preparationMethod: Cut capsicum into tiny pieces.
Take oil in a kadai and fry onions & capsicum .
When it is half cooked add salt and red chilli powder. fry till capsicum gets cooked.
Take sour cream in a bowl,add the onions & capsicum.
next add cut tomato pieces , chopped corriander , pepper powder, chat masala and salt.
Mix well and chill overnight.
When ready to serve, take one tablespoon of the mixture and top it over a krack jack biscuit and its ready to serve.

recipeDescription: A delectable lahsun ki chutney or garlic chutney recipe with garlic blended with roasted coconut, red chillies and salt into a coarse paste. The lehsun ki chutney taste superb with fried snacks and grilled tikkas.
preparationMethod: Heat a pan, add the coconut and roast till they turn golden brown.
Remove and keep aside to cool.
Heat the oil in a pan, add the garlic and saute for a minute.
Cool and blend in a mixer along with roasted coconut, red chili powder and salt to a coarse powder.
Serve immediately or store refrigerated.
This chutney keeps well in an airtight container.

recipeDescription: It's a very good dish with roti and chapati.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil, add the paste and saute on a medium flame for a few minutes.
Add the salt and chilli powder, mushrooms and 1 cup of water, cover and cook for 4-5 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: Paneer korma is an easy spicy paneer recipe with creamy paneer cubes cooked in a delicious onion tomato mix. The paneer are stir fried in a spicy kurma and served with roti or paranthas.
preparationMethod: Heat the ghee in a pan, add the onions and cardamoms and saute for 3 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, mix well and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the chilli powder and turmeric powder and saute on a medium flame for a few minutes.
Add the paneer, cream and salt and mix well.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: Delicious and quick snack. . . Perfect for a cocktail party!
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a large wok and add the tomatoes. Cober and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes.

Add chilli-garlic sauce and onions along with the chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander-cumin seeds powder and garam masala, mix well and cook for another 2 to 4 minutes, while stirring once in between.
Add the capsicum and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes.
Add the salt and paneer and cook on a slow flame for 1 to 2 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: Spicy paneer tomato coins are an easy breakfast sandwich recipe which is healthy and quick. The breads slices are cut in circulars and then spread with a mixture comprising of grated cheese, paneer, chillies, pepper and salt.
preparationMethod: Combine the paneer, chillies, cheese, tomato, salt and pepper powder in a bowl and mix well.
Take a slice of bread and spread a portion of the mixture evenly on top of each bread slice.
Place these bread slices in a greased baking tray and bake in a pre-heated oven and toast till the crust turns golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Make this high protein no fuss sandwich..simply nutritious and healthy!
preparationMethod: Combine the coriander, green chilli and ginger and blend in a mixer till smooth. Keep aside.
Combine the salt, lemon juice, cumin seeds powder and rajma in a bowl and mix well.
Apply some butter on both the sides of the bread slices.
Spoon the rajma mixture on bread slice and cover with another piece of bread buttered on both sides.
Put in pre-heated sandwich maker for 5 minutes or till they turn golden brown.
Serve with mustard sauce.
Put the raspberries, honey, lemon juice and water into a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce the heat to a gentle simmer and cook until the fruit has completely broken down, about five minutes.
Remove from the flame and let stand until cool.
Pour the mixture into a fine mesh strainer set over a pitcher. Press the fruit solids with a rubber spatula to remove as much liquid as possible.
Discard the fruit pulp.
To serve, fill a glass with ice and pour three tablespoons of the raspberry syrup into the glass.
Fill with water, stir, garnish with raspberries or a lemon wedge and serve immediately.

recipeDescription: A spicy chutney that will touch your taste buds and goes well with sandwich of any type.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients and blend in a mixer to a smooth paste, using enough water.
Transfer in a bowl and serve immediately or store refrigerated til use.
Use as required.
Left over bread slice can be also used especially the very 1st slice which we don't use often. Also a slice of green capsicum can be added to this chutney to enhance the green color.

recipeDescription: Spicy sev makes for a spicy delicious snacking item with evening tea or coffee. The spice laden gram flour or besan based sev recipe is crispy and sure to delight all.
preparationMethod: Dry roast the cloves on a tawa on low heat for 3 to 4 mins.
When cool pwder them.
Shift clove powder gram flour salt chilli powder pepper powder and soda bicarb together.
Add about 1 cup of water and mix to a smooth dough.
Knead well.
Put a handful of the dough into the sev mould fitted with medium sieve and press directly into the hot oil kadai.
Fry on hidh heaqqt till done on both side and crisp.
Store in airtight container.

recipeDescription: Cook the tofu or soya paneer in this Spicy tofu recipe and enjoy with rotis or parathas. The tofu cubes are cooked with onion, tomatoe, chillies, ginger garlic paste and select seasoning powders in this stirfry recipe.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in kadai and fry garlic, ginger, spring onions, corriander leaves and green chillies till there is a nice aroma.
Add the soya and chilli sauce. add all the vegetables and mix well.
Check and add salt according to taste as soya sauce also has salt. sprinkle water if needed. add tofu and mix well. add the lightly roasted til.
Let the flavours soak into the tofu for 5 min.
Garnish with onion greens and serve hot.

recipeDescription: A spicy tomato capsi pizza recipe with a freshly baked thin pizza base and an array of vegetables like capsicum and tomatoes stir fried with garlic paste and used as pizza topping.
preparationMethod: First of all spread the tomato sauce on the base.
Then spread the grated cheese on the base.
Then add the sliced tomatoes and capsicum on it[1 tomato slice 1capsicum slice]
Add more cheese on it along with a pinch of salt sprinkled evenly.
Bake the base for 10 min in a preheated oven.
When its baked take it out and sprikle the chilly flakes,oregano and tabasco.
Serve hot after cutting into slices.

recipeDescription: Spinach & macaroni soup makes for a delectable combination of boiled macaroni with spinach puree in this hot tasty soup recipe.
preparationMethod: Wash the spinach leaves and cook on a slow flame for a few minutes with very little water.
Make paste in grinder after it cools down.
Boil the macroni with litle oil and salt in water and strain.
Chop the onions finely and fry in butter till cooked.
Add the plain floor and cook again till the floor is cooked and is light in weight. add some butter if the mixture seems too dry.
Add milk to this and cook until the mixture is tick and boils.
Add the macroni, spinach paste, salt and pepper.
Add some water to make proper thickness of the soup.
Cook till the soup boils.
Serve hot with little grated cheese (optional).

recipeDescription: Get ready to devour the amazing combination of boiled macaroni with a spicy healthy spinach curry in the spinach and macaroni curry. Relish the curry as a side dish with a bowl of soup.
preparationMethod: Combine the ginger, green chillie and tomato and blend in a mixer till smooth. Keep aside.
Coarsely grind the fennel seeds and pepper, mix well and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a pan and add the cumin seeds. When the seeds crackle, add the garlic and onions and saute till the onions turn translucent.
Add the prepared tomato paste, fennel seeds powder and mix well. Saute till the mixture leaves oil from the sides.
Add the spinach puree, salt, turmeric , chilli powder, dhania powder, kasuri methi and mix well.
Add little water and when it boils, add the macaroni and boil once.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Before placing the baking dishes in the oven check the temperature. do not place in lower heat. serve hot.
preparationMethod: Mix dough ingredients;
Knead for about 2-3 minutes by adding flour to until it doesn''t stick to the hands
Separate into 3 equal parts
Keep them aside
Mix the filling ingredients
Roll out the 3 dough balls - so that each one is a bit bigger than your baking pan (i use 8x12 in.) - the amount of dough, for that size will give you the right thickness
Place the first layer on the greased pan, with ends hanging over the pan rim - add half the filling
Follow on with the second dough layer -add the rest of the filling
Finish off with the last dough layer using the third part of the dough.
Fold the dough layers together
Pluck a few holes, making sure you go through the second layer of dough
Bake for 45 min. at 400f

recipeDescription: A mix spinach,cheeses,onions,oregano,basil,salt and pepper filled between two sheet os ravioli pasta.
preparationMethod: Mix spinach,cheeses,onions,oregano,basil,salt and pepper to form a nice even mixture.
Cut open ravioli fill in with mixture.
Bring water to a boil and boil the ravioli''''s for about 2mins. they dont take too long
Melt butter in a pan add garlic and fresh basil and pepper to that.
Serve ravioli''''s with hot butter n garlic sauce.
More cheese can also be shredded on top for flavor and look.

tag: Babies, Toddler and Kids Iron Rich Foods
recipeDescription: A soothing, warming and iron rich spinach soup recipe for any time of the year. A wonderfully comforting soup prepared by blending spinach leaves or palak with spices and cream, spinach soup is tasty and quite popular in most cuisines.
preparationMethod: put spinach and cucumber in a saucepan along with water and cook until tender on medium heat. or pressure cook it (one whistle).
On cooling, blend it in electric blender to make smoothy paste.
Heat butter in a pan. add black pepper powder, cumin powder, ginger paste, salt.
Add blended spinach-cucumber and lemon juice.cook on medium heat for 5 minutes.
Serve hot

recipeDescription: A flavoursome Spinach moroho typically contains chopped spinach and onions which are cooked in oil and flavoured with salt, red chillies and spices. Enjoy as side dish with breads of choice.
preparationMethod: Chopped spinach and boiled in the patila with 2 cup of water.
Add the sliced onion and tomatoes in spinach .
Then add the red chilli powder (make paste whole chilli,ginger,papreca)and add in the spinach.
Add the margin and salt to tast and cover the patila cooked 10min.
Serve hot as a side dish.

recipeDescription: Surprise your guest with this novel Spring onion & cheese sandwich recipe. The finely chopped spring onions and cheese make for a delightful sandwich filling and can be served cold or grilled with ketchup as snack or breakfast.
preparationMethod: Spread butter on one side of all bread slices evenly.
Chop sring onions finely
Mix spring onions & cheese.
To this mixture add salt & pepper
Cover another buttered slice of bread.
Toast in a sandwich maker

recipeDescription: Butter can be used instead of lard. shake and jiggle the pan while cooking to give a flaky pastry finish.
preparationMethod: Take the flour into a bowl and gently pour in boiling water. stir for 5 min then add cold water and knead to a firm dough.
Cover with damp cloth or invert a bowl on it and leave for 25-30 min.
On a lightly floured surface,roll the dough and make it strech long.
Divide into 10 sections.roll each section into a flat pancake.
Sprinkle with chopped scallions,salt and lard.fold up the pan cakes from sides and roll again to make 1/4 inch thin pancake.
Heat oil in a pre heated frying pan and fry pancakes one at a time over medium heat for 5 min turning over once.

recipeDescription: You also use chole in stffing
preparationMethod: boil the noodles in boiling water .cut the vegetables in long sleek pieces. fry the vegetables and baked beans in oil.
Mix vegetables and noodles, put salt , soya sauce.chili sauce and tomato sauce .
Noodles are ready. then make dosa on dosa tava , staff the vegetables in it and great the cheese on it and roll it. and serve hot ,garnish with spring onion ring (serve coconut chtany with us)

recipeDescription: Springonions&besankisubzi is a novel Indian vegetable recipe with spring onions sautéed with roasted besan or gram flour and select seasonings.
preparationMethod: Finely cut the spring onions.
In a pan fry the spring onions with little oil.
After they are half cooked. add the besan,salt,red chilly powder, haldi powder & black pepper & 1/2 cup water.
Cook untill the water gets dried & the spring onions are cooked fully.

recipeDescription: It is a nourishing , fat free recipe. ideal for breakfast and all time snacks.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a kadai, fry onion till light brown, add green chillies,capsicum, saute lightly. add tomatoes, seasoning.add rest of the ingredients including steamed sprouts.keep it aside.heat non stick tawa , slighly roast prepared pancakes and top with the prepared sprouts filling, fold them one by one and garnish with fresh grated cottage cheese

recipeDescription: Sprout sandwich makes the good old sandwich recipe a healthy protein rich one with the addition of bean sprouts as filling. Enjoy as packed lunch, snack or breakfast.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a presure cooker
Add chopped onions and chillies till light brown
Add the tomatoe puree and grated ginger and cook till it leaves the side
Add the sprouts, salt and pepper and1/4 cup water
Cook for 2 whistles
Cool it and mash it slightly
Take a slice of brown bread, spread cheese spread on one slice and sprinkle jeera powder on it.
Spread the sprout mixture on another slice and make a sandwich
Make the rest of the sandwiches in the same way.
Toast it on the tava or grill it in the sandwich maker till brown and crisp
Server hot with tamarind or tomato sauce

recipeDescription: Another new version of healthy and nutritious protein rich idli with sprouted green gram.
preparationMethod: Steam the sprouts till soft,Add green chili, ginger and salt.
Cool and add to the idli batter.
Pour spoonfuls of the batter into greased idli moulds and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Cool slightly and unmould the idlis.
Serve hot with chutney of your choice or sambhar.

recipeDescription: This is very tasty chaat loved by kids. This is a healthy recipe too.
preparationMethod: Boil the sprouted moong for 15 minutes,and take it out in a bowl.
Then add green chutney,sweet chutney,chat masala,chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
While serving garnish with coriander leaves sev and finely chopped onion.
Serve immediately.

recipeName: Sprouted Moong, How To Sprout Moong At Home
recipeDescription: Sprouted Moong are fiber dense and healthy with good nutritive values.It is super easy to germinate and achieve long moong bean sprouts at home. These sprouts are crunchy and delicious, eat them raw or add to soups, salads, pulaos, chaats, make subzis and curries or just stir-fry. Here we show you how to grow moong sprouts at home.
preparationMethod: To grow bean sprouts, first wash the moong and soak in water for a minimum 4 hours.
Drain thoroughly and wait for 5 minutes.
Keep in a jar covered with a piece of cloth for 5 to 6 hours.
Place in the refrigerator overnight.
Next day, wash thoroughly, drain and again keep in a jar covered with a piece of cioth for 5 to 6 hours.
Place in the refrigerator overnight.
Sprinkle water on the sprouted beans on the third day and store in the refrigerator until required for use.

recipeDescription: A quick and healthy recipe for those untimed hunger cravings. Rich in anti oxidants , irons and minerals , it will keep you energized.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a non stick pan and add turmeric, crushed garlic and coriander and saute for a few seconds.
Add the sprouts and mix well, add salt and 1/4 cup water
Cover the pan with a lid and allow to cook for 3-4 minutes or till the sprouts become a little soft.
Serve hot garnished with chopped tomatoes and a slice of lemon.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch) powder
recipeDescription: Broccoli is a plant in cabbage family. It's flower head is used as a vegetable. Broccoli is commonly steamed, boiled or sauteed. It is high in vitamin c and also in dietary fiber. Long back, I had this cheesy broccoli soup and it tasted heavenly but it was very high in calories. So I made this somewhat lighter version of this soup. With a very few ingredients, this broccoli soup is easy to make.
preparationMethod: Heat the butter in a deep pan, add the onions and saute until translucent.
Add the broccoli, cover and cook for around 5-7 minutes stirring in between.
Add the stock, bring it to a boil and then simmer half covered until broccoli is nice and tender.
Once cooled puree it in a blender reserving 1/3 cup of the liquid. Transfer the blended soup and reserved liquid in a pot, add 1/2 cup milk and gently heat the soup again.
Season the soup with salt and pepper and serve hot.

recipeDescription: Its a stylish dish, which u can serve with hard drinks too.spl.for vegetarians. u can have these in navratara days too. avoiding onions.
preparationMethod: First boil the soyabeans,and then drain them and take out whole the extra water
Then cut 3 of capsicum in square size,and same as onion.
Then take a skewer and place in a order....one soyabean,one capsicum,one soyabeab,one onion.and continue the same process.
And after that heat a plane tawa and put little bit of oil..and saute theses sticks from both of the sides.
Now add some o the salt and pepper on them.
Serve in a plate and put tobasco sauce on them,as per ur taste.

recipeName: Stir fried mushrooms with eggs and spring onions
recipeDescription: Different ,tasty and healthy
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a frying pan or a wok. add ginger juliennes and button mushrooms. sauté for 5minutes or till soft . add soya sauce and vinegar. cook for a minute. sprinkle salt and pepper. scramble the eggs separately and add to the mushrooms and spring onions. mix lightly and serve hot

tag: Finger Foods for Babies, Toddlers and Kids
recipeDescription: This recipe can be loved by children. It is little bit salty, hot and sour. Best when serve chilled.
preparationMethod: Take tamarind in a cup and mix salt, chilli powder and cumin seeds to it.
Make it like a soft mixture and roll it like a balls.
Now pin toothpics to it.
Now your tamarind lollypop is ready
Tastes best when it is chilled.

recipeDescription: Ditch normal bhajiyas for this unique and masaledar bhajiyas which will definitely pep up your mood .Liked by young and old both its perfect combination with tea on a rainy day.
preparationMethod: Spread out the tomato slices on a plate and sprinkle the prepared masala on top of each slice .
Take each slice n dip it in batter n put it hot oil for frying . Make sure the masala doesn't get mixed in batter when you are dipping it in batter.
Also when you are frying masala side should be on top ;later can turn on other side for frying .
Fry it on medium high heat till golden in color.
Serve it with tea or ketchup.

recipeDescription: A Tandoori item, Tandoori gobi or grilled cauliflower is simply grilled to perfection. The marinated gobhi florets with an amazing blend of herbs and masala is a great starter or side dish.
preparationMethod: Grind onion, ginger, red chilies, cumin seeds and coriander seeds to a smooth paste. lightly steam cauliflower and fry in a kadhai till golden. take out.
Take 2 tbsps. of the used oil for further cooking.
Stir-fry ground paste in used oil with sprinkling of water till pale gold, add tomatoes, reduce heat, cover and occasionally stir. cook for 4 to 5 minutes.
Place the fried cauliflower in the tandoor pan / preheated oven.pour on the tomato-onion mixture, smear with cream. cover the tandoor for about 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve on a platter, pour the sauce over it and sprinkle on top with
Garam masala powder and freshly chopped coriander leaves.

recipeDescription: A tandoori item, Tandoori gobi is a cauliflower barbe que recipe which is grilled to perfection. The marinated cauliflowers or gobhi with an amazing blend of herbs and masala is a great starter.
preparationMethod: 1. grind onion, ginger, red chilies, cumin seeds and coriander seeds to a smooth paste. lightly steam cauliflower and fry in a kadhai till golden. take out.
2.take 2 tbsps. of the used oil for further cooking.
3. stir-fry ground paste in used oil with sprinkling of water till pale gold, add tomatoes, reduce heat, cover and occasionally stir. cook for 4 to 5 minutes.
4. place the fried cauliflower in the tandoor pan / preheated oven.pour on the tomato-onion mixture, smear with cream. cover the tandoor for about 15 to 20 minutes.
5. serve on a platter, pour the sauce over it and sprinkle on top with garam masala powder and freshly chopped coriander leaves.

recipeDescription: A tandoori item, Tandoori gobi is a cauliflower barbe que recipe which is grilled to perfection. The marinated cauliflowers or gobhi with an amazing blend of herbs and masala is a great starter.
preparationMethod: Grind onion, ginger, red chilies, cumin seeds and coriander seeds to a smooth paste. lightly steam cauliflower and fry in a kadhai till golden. take out.
Take 2 tbsps. of the used oil for further cooking.
Stir-fry ground paste in used oil with sprinkling of water till pale gold, add tomatoes, reduce heat, cover and occasionally stir. cook for 4 to 5 minutes.
Place the fried cauliflower in the tandoor pan / preheated oven.pour on the tomato-onion mixture, smear with cream. cover the tandoor for about 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve on a platter, pour the sauce over it and sprinkle on top with
Garam masala powder and freshly chopped coriander leaves.

recipeDescription: It wiil give beautiful shadings to the glass in 3 layers.serve it cold.do not stirr while serving.
preparationMethod: Take a decorative tall glass.
Fill 1/8 th of a glass withrose syrup.
Add equal amount of coconut water.
Add 2 it scoop of the icecream.
Then pour mirinda in rest of the glass.

recipeDescription: A perfect recipe that goes well with roti and suits best for dinners.
preparationMethod: Heat the butter in a deep pan and fry the paneer cubes till golden brown in colour from all the sides. Keep aside.
Combine the remaining ingredients, except water, in a bowl and mix well.
Add the fried paneer to this mixture and cook on a slow flame for 5-10 minutes.
Add the water, mix well and cook on a slow flame for 10-15 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with green chillies.

recipeDescription: Tangy sand is a spicy sandwich recipe with a tangy filling. The paneer, capsicum, cabbage are cooked together with tamarind pulp and pepper powder and then filled in between the buttered slices.
preparationMethod: Shallow fry the bread from both the sides.
Mix all the ingredients.
Sandwich the ingredients in these slices .
Sprinkle some chaat masala on to the sand wich and roll the sandwich in a cauliflower leaf.
Serve with hot coffee

recipeDescription: The water obtained by pressing the grated cucumber can be applied on the face hands -a very good astringent
preparationMethod: Grate the cucumbers,press and drain out its water,
Mix the ground rai, pepper powder, salt,cucumber to the white butter,
Spread a thick layer of the mixture on the bread slice and cover with another slice,
Cut the sides and serve.
Ps. 1or 2 green chillies can be ground and added to the butter mixture if one requires a spicy sandwich.

recipeDescription: Roasted papdi will be better than fried papdi as it will be crunchy.
preparationMethod: Roast the papdi do not fry it.
Then on the roasted papdi put some oil then put red chillipowder,hara dhania,salt,tomatoes and a pinch of chaat masala,and sev on it

recipeDescription: Tasty noodles is a tasty noodles or spaghetti recipe with boiled noodles stir fried with vegetables and sauces. A healthy accompaniment or side dish which also makes for a perfect tiffin or packed lunch option with salads.
preparationMethod: Fry the noodles add keep aside
Take a pan add 2table spoon oil
Add jeera when breaks
Add onion ,tomatoos,and green chillies fry till little brown
Add tomatto ketshup
Now add the fried noodles
Add salt, redchillie sause, and peper now add 1 cup water
And let it cook for 5 to 7 minutes
Now add ths maggie ready masalla
Mix every thing well and serve hot

recipeDescription: This is great to finish-off leftover idlis; especially when idlis don't come out well. the chat masala and dhania give it a lovely taste and goes well with tea on a cold evening.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a wok.
Cut all idlis into quarters.
Fry them until golden brown.
Put on tissue paper to soak excess oil.
Sprinkle chat masala and chopped dhania.
Serve immediatetly as snack with tea or cold drink.

recipeDescription: A quick snack made using left over breads. Bread pieces cooked with onions, tomatoes, capsicum and masalas gives a satisfying snacky feel. Enjoy as it is, or top it on cream cracker or monaco biscuits or plain khakhras.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a pan and add the onions and capsicum. Saute on a medium flame for 5 to 6 minutes, or till the onions turn light brown.
Add the tomatoes, mix well and cook for 3 more minutes, till tomatoes are cooked.
Add the red chilli powder, garam masala, chaat masala and salt, mix well and saute for another 1 minute.
Add the bread pieces and toss well.
Cover and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the coriander, mix well and again close the lid and cook it for 1 minute.
Serve hot with butter on top.

recipeDescription: A delightful paneer khurchan recipe comes right from a chef's table and can now be recreated at home. The paneer or cottage cheese is crumbled and sauteed with onions, green chillies, tomatoes, pepper and spice. Relish paneer khurchan or bhurjee with chapati.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a tava and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the onions and saute till they turn translucent.
Add the paneer and tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the turmeric, chilli powder and salt and mix well.
Transfer in a bowl and garnish with the green chilli and coriander.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: For simple and fresh start of the day with tea.
preparationMethod: Pre heat the oven at 180 degree Celsius or heat tava.
In a small bowl, combine all the ingredients except bread. Take bread strips and lightly spread the mixture on the top of the bread and roast it until crisp and golden with the help of oven or tava.
Garnish it with coconut and serve it fresh with fresh warm green tea.

recipeDescription: If the paneer is hard then soak it in warm water for 5 - 10 minutes before frying.
preparationMethod: Heat the butter in a pan, add the panner and saute till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Add the remaining ingredients, mix well and cook for 10 minutes, stirring in between.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Feel the chill with this Indian Sherbet!
preparationMethod: Crush the ice cubes and keep aside.
Pour water in a big bowl and squeeze the lemons in it.
Add black salt and stir well.
Add crushed ice and pour in separate glasses
Garnish with lemons.

recipeDescription: Thidir (instant) bread toast is an easy and simpler version of French toast. The bread slices are dipped in a spicy egg mixture and then shallow fried till crispy golden. Serve the their or bread toast with mint chutney or ketchup.
preparationMethod: In a bowl break & beat the eggs well & add all the ingredients.
Place a non-stick tawa on a stove,
After it gets heated up grease it with ghee. then dip the bread slices in the egg batter & cook them 2-4 slices(depending upon the size of the tawa)at a
Time.
Serve with sauce or pudina chutney.

recipeName: Three Bell Pepper Salad with Sesame Dressing
recipeDescription: This salad is combination of three bell pepper;red,green ,yellow and paneer with sesame oil dressing.
preparationMethod: First cut red, green and yellow bell pepper symmetrically about 2 inch long and 1/2 inch broad.
Now heat water in a skillet and blanch capsicum for 2 min and then strain water and put in bowl full of ice.
Now cut paneer in the same dimension as capsicum.
For dressing take all the ingredients in a big bowl and muddle it with a muddler now add all the capsicum and paneer/tofu to the dressing and mix it with light hand.
Now empty the salad in a serving dish and garnish with roasted sesame seed .
Roasted sesame seed should be lightly roasted and should retain its white colour.

recipeDescription: Tindora or tendli is very popular in the south, especially andhra. I prepared this dish with a tempering of mustard, curry leaves and asafoetida and finished off with a combination of masalas like coriander and cummin seeds, dry red chillies and sesame seeds. Lemon juice is added instead of tamarind for that tangy taste. Perfect as a side dish or with chapattis.
preparationMethod: Pressure cook the tendli pieces for 4 whistles. Do not add any water to it. Only add little water in the cooker.
Dry roast the coriander seeds, cummin seeds, sesame seeds and red chillies for few seconds and then grind into a powder. Keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan and temper with the mustard seeds, curry leaves and asafoetida. After it stops spluttering add the onion and garlic and saute till light brown.
Now add the boiled tindora, salt and turmeric powder and fry for 5 minutes, covered.
Add the powdered masala and mix well. Continue to fry uncovered for a further 3 minutes.
When done, add the lemon juice, mix well and serve.

ingredients: chopped capsicum chopped onions chopped tomatoes
dried oregano, basil black pepper (kalimirch) powder
recipeDescription: A yummy cocktail snack made with mini pizza bases topped with veggies. Serve as a fun food for children also.
preparationMethod: Set the oven to low heat.
Spread tomato sauce on each bagel half.
Sprinkle the shredded cheese all over the tomato sauce on each half.
Add your favorite toppings.
Put a light sprinkling of seasonings on each half.
Put your bagel halves on the baking sheet.
Bake in the oven on low heat for about 5 to 8 minutes. you'll know they're done when the cheese is bubbly.
Let cool for a minute, then enjoy your tiny pizzas!

recipeDescription: If some water is there while heating the oil in the vessel and it starts coming out put some salt in it it will stop . try it it will work
preparationMethod: Nil

recipeDescription: Squeeze about half a lemon in paneer dishes. paneer will not turn hard on reheating.
preparationMethod: Nil

recipeDescription: Toasted Baked Beans is a protein rich toast recipe with the baked beans . Enjoy this delicious bean recipe with breads of choice as meal or breakfast.
preparationMethod: Cut the bread inot small squares&deep fry them till golden brown.
Take the beans in a pan & add some water to dilute it.let it boil.
In seprate bowls place some fried bread, pour some beans with gravy.
Spread some onion chilly& grated cheese.
Serve immadiately.

recipeDescription: A simple Toasted sandwich recipe for breakfast or packed tiffin. The bread slices are buttered and filled with vegetables before toasting or grilling them to a crispy finish.
preparationMethod: Grill brinjal, & the peppers or alternatively saute without oil in a non stick pan until slightly done.cut the bread in two.
Spread margarine..place the cheese on one side of the bread.
Layer brinjal, peppers, tomato & sprinkle salt, oregano ,pepper powder& tobasco.
Close the half with the other half of the bread & place it on a sandwich toaster until done.

recipeDescription: Paalak paneer or paneer cooked with spinach puree along with a choice of spices, cream and garlic paste.
preparationMethod: Combine the spinach, tomato, onion and ginger and pressure cook with 1-cup water for 2 minutes.
Cool and blend in a mixer till smooth. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the paneer till golden brown. Drain and keep aside.
In the same oil, add the cumin seeds. Bayleaf, garlic and green chilly.
When the seeds crackle, add the spinach paste and salt, mix well and saute for a minute.
Add the besan and stir continuously so that besan dissolves in spinach completely.
Add the garam masala and kasoori methi and mix well.
Cook till paalak thickens or till you reach the desired consistency of spinach.
Add the paneer cubes, mix well and garnish with malai and grated paneer.
Serve hot with paraatha.

recipeDescription: People who enjoy paan can enjoy this chocolate.
preparationMethod: Melt the white chocolate in microwave for 30 secs.
Add the rest of the ingredients to the melted chocolate.
Mix well and pour into chocolate moulds and refrigerate for 5 minutes.
Take out from the moulds after 5 minutes and serve as mouth freshener.

recipeDescription: Do remember to store the puris in an air-tight container. You can always refresh them by baking them in a slow oven for 4 to 5 minutes. You can use ragda instead of the sprouts or boondi.
preparationMethod: Combine the semolina, plain flour, soda water and salt to make a semi-stiff dough and knead well. Allow it to rest under a wet muslin cloth for 10 to 15 minutes.
Divide the dough into 40 equal portions and roll each portion into 37 mm. (1½") circles.
Place these circles under a damp cloth for about 5 minutes.
Deep fry in a kadhai in hot oil on a medium flame till they puff up and are golden brown (press each puri using a slotted spoon till they puff up in the oil).
Remove, drain on absorbent paper and store in an air-tight container.
Soak the tamarind in ½ cup of water for approximately 1 hour. Strain out all the pulp through a sieve.
Combine this pulp with the remaining ingredients except the black salt in a blender and grind to a fine paste using a little water.
Transfer the paste into a large bowl and combine with 1 litre of water, the black salt and salt and mix well.
Chill for at least 2 to 3 hours after making so that all the flavours have blended properly.
Crack a small hole in the centre of each puri.
Fill with a little sprouts or boondi, then top a little khajur imli ki chutney, immerse it in the chilled pani and eat immediately.

recipeDescription: A deep fried delight. . Tastes best with a hot cup of tea!
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients and mix well adding little water and keep aside for 2 minutes.
Heat the oil in a kadai and drop a spoonful of batter and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot.

recipeDescription: A kebab recipe with difference!!!
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Divide the mixture into 10 equal portions and shape them into small round flat kebabs.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry till they turn crisp.
Serve hot with sauce.

recipeDescription: Palak and paneer tikka is a tikka recipe with paneer cubes and chopped spinach grilled together to a tasty and flavourful finish. Enjoy as starter or snack with beverage of choice.
preparationMethod: Combine the paneer, spinach, vegetables and mix well.
Add the green chillies and bread, mix well and add the salt and pepper and mix well.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape each portion into small round flat tikkis.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the tikkis till they turn golden and crisp from all the sides.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: You can serve without tempering. try aamchur powder instead of lemon juce.
preparationMethod: Cut palak finely and add all the ingredients except atta and mix well.
In a bowl mix atta and oil well.
Now mix atta and palak well and make very soft dough using water if needed.
Make oval shaped 4 balls and steam it in dhokla cooker for 30 minutes.
Cut all the cooked balls making 5 peices of each.
In a kadai, heat oil and put rai ,hing and karipatta.
Then add cut peices of muthiya and mix well.
Serve hot with sauce/chhunda/butter.

recipeDescription: If not ice water can use cold water
preparationMethod: On the gas, take a fying pan.
Put the butter in it
Put the gas on slow flame.
After butter melts, put the maida in it.
Mix slowly until brown.
Slowly add milk to the mixture
Take care of the lumps
Lumps should not form
Mix till it gets thick
Add black pepper & salt
Take it off the gas.
Boil the gobi
After the gobi cools
Put in to the grinder
After mix the mixture into the white sauce
Boil the palak (do not cut)
Only for 1sec boil
Remove it and put in to the ice water
Keep aside
Take a frying pan
Boil all the vegetables
After it boils
Off the gas add the gratedcheese (little)
Remove the whole palak from the ice warter
& then spread the vege mix on the palak.
Roll it and keep aside.
Take an ovenproof plate
Pour little white sauce
On that put some of the rolls
On that put the white sauce reapet the same thing mahke layers if some of vege mix is left
Cover the surroundings take all the cheese pour it
Put in the oven 180preheatead
The eat it.

recipeDescription: The iron cladded palak paneer is not only rich in taste and flavour but also in healthful benefits imparted by the delightful combination of paneer getting cooked in spicy spinach puree based rich gravy. Enjoy with roti or oparatha.
preparationMethod: Boil the spinach leaves in a pressure cooker for 3-4 whistles.
Cool, drain the excess water and wash them with cold water.
Blend the spinach leaves into a puree and keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a pan deep fry paneer cubes till a little pink. Keep aside.
Heat the remaining ghee in a pan, add the basil and cloves and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and onions and saute for 3 minutes.
Add the red chilli powder, garam masala, mix well and saute till the onion turns soft and pink.
Add the spinach puree and salt, mix well and add some water to adjust the consistency.
Bring to boil, add the paneer and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the cream and serve hot.

tag: Babies, Toddler and Kids Iron Rich Foods
recipeDescription: A delicious palak paneer recipe made with a zest of sua bhaji..
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a big pan and add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the asafoetida, ginger-garlic-green chilli paste and saute for some time.
Add the spinach-suva paste to this and mix well and saute for some time.
Add all the masalas and a little water, mix well and simmer for some time.
Add the paneer and mix gently.
Add the garma masala and simmer for 4 minutes.
Serve hot with rotis/chapatis.

recipeDescription: Serve with parantha and cucumber railta.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the spinach and green chillies and saute for 3 minutes.
Add the red chilli powder and cook till the water is reduced to half.
Add the horse gram and salt, mix well and cook for 4 to 5 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander. Hot.

recipeDescription: Aromatic and flavorful crisp bhajiyas made with nagarvel leaves.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a deep bowl and make smooth semi thick batter using water. Add soda and mix well.
Heat oil for deep frying and drop small round bhajiyas in it. Deep fry untill crisp and brown.
Drain and serve hot.

recipeDescription: Tasty and spicy breakfast recipe. Eat with tea or coffee.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Make small balls and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: An easy, quick to make delicious paneer recipe.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a pan, add the onions and saute till they turn golden brown in colour.
Add the tomatoes, mix well and saute till they turn soft.
Add the chilli powder, garam masala and salt, mix well and saute till the mixture leaves the oil.
Add the paneer and saute on a high flame for 1/2 to 1 minute.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: A healthy and delicious tea time snack. Easy to cook with easily available ingredients!
preparationMethod: Take four bread slices and remove the sides.
Combine all the ingredients with very little water to make thick paste .
Apply this paste on one side of each slice and brush this side with melted butter.
Cut each slice into 3 sticks and bake in preheated oven at 190 degree Celsius for 5 to 7 minutes or till they turn golden brown.
Sprinkle chaat masala and coriander.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: A delicious vegetable recipe, paneer capsicum has the soft and succulent paneer cubes tossed with capsicum, onion, tomatoes and spice powders.
preparationMethod: Combine the coriander seeds and red chilies and pound in a mortar pestle till coarsely crushed. Keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a pan, add the garlic paste and saute on a slow flame for a few seconds.
Add the capsicum and pounded spices and cook on a slow flame for 30 seconds.
Add the green chilies and ginger and saute again for a few seconds.
Add the tomatoes and cook till the ghee leaves the sides.
Add the kasoori methi and salt and saute again for a few seconds.
Add the sliced paneer and cook for a few minutes.
Sprinkle coriander on the top and serve hot.

recipeDescription: A royal paneer delicacy recipe!!!
preparationMethod: Combine the cashewnuts, ginger, green chillies, 1/2 of the cardamoms and milk and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Heat ghee in a pan, add the cloves and the remaining cardamoms and onions and saute till the onions turn golden brown in colour.
Add the prepared paste, mix well and saute for 2 minutes.
Add salt and pepper and paneer, mix well and cook for some time.
Add the cream and mix well.
Serve hot garnished with coriander, saffron drops, and almond flakes.

recipeName: Paneer Chandni - A Royal Paneer Delicacy
recipeDescription: Paneer chandni - a royal paneer delicacy. This has been adopted from a five star hotel recipe of mild spicy paneer dish. This is a tribute to my favorite director mr. Yash chopra who passed away recently. This recipe is very royal as the main ingredients used are very royal and rich. Hence, this recipe also resembles to yashji's movies.
preparationMethod: Cut the paneer into cubes of approx 1 inch each and set aside.
Soak the saffron strands in milk for garnishing.
Heat the ghee in a pan.
Add cloves and crushed cardamoms and saute for 1 minute.
Add the onions and saute till the onions turn translucent.
Add the cashew-mava paste, mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the salt and pepper and add the pieces of paneer.
Lastly, stir in fresh cream and mix well.
Transfer it into a serving bowl.
Garnish with almond flakes, soaked saffron and silver leaves (varq).
Serve hot with roti or naan.

recipeDescription: Paneer cheese fingers exhibit one of the most delicious snack or starter recipes with grated cottage cheese and processed cheese mixed together with select seasonings.
preparationMethod: Soak the pav in salted water for 1/2 a minute and squeeze out all excess water.
Combine the soaked pav, and the other ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape into small fingers shape.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Serve hot with tomato ketchup or green mint chutney.

recipeDescription: Paneer-cheese nuggets, are a crispy snacks and kids love these as finger food in lunchboxes.
preparationMethod: Combine the paneer, cheese and garlic in a bowl and keep aside for 15 minutes.
In another bowl, combine the flour and salt and mix well. Keep aside.
Roll the paneer-cheese pieces in flour and refrigerate the pieces for 15 minutes.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep-fry the paneer-cheese pieces till it turns crispy and golden brown in colour.
Drain on a absorbent paper.
Serve hot with tomato sauce.

recipeDescription: Paneer jalfraezi is a specaility paneer or cottage cheese dish with select vegetables stir fried together. The paneer jalfarezi taste superb with the succulent paneer cubes cooked in a rich creamy gravy. A must have vegetable dish for parties.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the red chillies and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the ginger, green chillies and onions, mix well and saute till onions turn translucent.
Add the red chilli powder and turmeric powder, mix well and add the capsicum and saute till they turn soft.
Add the paneer and toss gently.
Add salt and vinegar and cook for two to three minutes.
Add the tomatoes and garam masala, mix well and cook for 3 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander leaves.

recipeDescription: A delightful paneer dish, the paneer jalfrezi has the paneer cubes tossed with chopped deseeded tomatoes and capsicum slices in a rich and delicious gravy. The subtly spiced paneer jalfrezi is best paired with parathas as a party special dish for family gatherings.
preparationMethod: Cut the paneer into 2" long pieces and keep aside.
De-seed the tomatoes and capsicums and cut them into 2" long slices with 1/4" width. Keep aside.
Cut the onions into thick slices and separate the layers. Keep aside.
Heat oil in a kadhai and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the red chillies and saute for 10 seconds.
Add ginger julienne, green chillies and onions and saute for 1 minute.
Add red chilli powder and turmeric powder, mix well and add the capsicum pieces and cook for two to three minutes.
Add the paneer fingers and toss gently.
Add salt and vinegar and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and garam masala powder, mix well and cook till the capsicum turns soft,
Serve hot garnished with coriander leaves.

recipeDescription: A wonderful malabari dish which i have learnt from a friend of mine so thought of sharing with everyone. I have made a few minor alternations to it and it taste just great. So please do try it and let me know
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the onions, tomatoes, capsicum, green chillies and saute for 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the asafoetida, turmeric, coriander powder, cumin seeds powder, chilli powder and salt and mix well for 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the coconut milk and mix well and cook for 1 minute.
Add the paneer cubes to the coconut gravy and gently stir for 1 minute.
Cover the pan with a lid and cook on a slow flame for another 3 to 4 minutes.
Serve hot with rotis or phulkas.

recipeDescription: Hot and spicy noodles with Thai touch.
preparationMethod: Heat little oil in a pan on a medium flame, add chilli sauce, paneer cubs and little salt; saute for a minute, stirring constantly.
Pick up paneer cubes in a dish, keep aside.
Heat the remaining oil, add capsicum, onion, all sauces and salt and saute for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently on high flame.
Add noodles and toss to mix well and and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add sauteed paneer cubes, stir well.
Garnish with spring onion greens and serve hot.

recipeDescription: An mouthwatering and very easy to prepare paneer noodle pakoda recipe using paneer, boiled noodles ,spices and green chilies. This crispy snack tastes superb with coriander and tomato chutney. Go relish!
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients, along with 2 cups water and mix well to make a smooth batter.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into round pakodas.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the pakodas till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: A delicious authentic paneer delicacy from the land of amritsar!
preparationMethod: Combine the flour, ginger, garlic, carom seeds and the masalas in a bowl, add 1/2 tbsp of oil and mix well.
Combine the onions with 2 tbsp if this mixture, mix well and keep aside for 30 minutes.
Add the paneer to the remaining mixture, mix well and keep aside to marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the onions and paneer till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper, insert tooth picks on each onions and paneer.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: A hot snack. . To be enjoyed in rains!!! with a hot cup of tea!
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients along with 1/2 cup of water, except the paneer, and blend in a mixer till smooth. Keep aside.
Sprinkle little salt and chilli powder on the paneer cubes and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, dip each paneer cube in the prepared batter and deep fry in hot oil till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve immediately with chutney.

recipeDescription: A mouthwatering paneer recipe cooked in true Peshawari style of cooking, paneer Peshawari brings the authentic taste of Peshawari cuisine on your tables.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a kadai.
Add jeera seeds & allow to crackle.
Then add in the chopped onions and sauti until light brown.
Add ginger - garlic paste + chopped tomatoes.
Cook till the oil surfaces on top.
Dilute the turmeric powder + jeera powder + garam masala powder + pepper powder in 2 tbsp water & add to the gravy.
Also add in the chopped green chillies.
Bhuno the masala for 2 mins.
Then add in the sliced onions + tomatoes + capsicum + 8-10 tbsp water.
Mix & cook for a couple of mins.
Then add in the cashewnut paste + butter + salt to taste.
Mix well & cook for 2-3 mins.
Finally add in the cream + crushed kasoori methi + paneer cubes & cook for a further 5 mins or until the paneer heats thru & becomes soft.
Check & adjust the seasoning.
Dish out the "paneer peshwari" in a bowl.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves, sprinkle with crushed kasoori methi.

recipeDescription: Paneer Sabji (kadai) is a Punjabi cuisine specialty, in which paneer cubes are simmered in a thick tomato based gravy cooked in a brass or metallic kadai. Serve with Garlic Naan or with parathas .
preparationMethod: Combine the coriander seeds and red chillies in a mixer and blend till coarse. Keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add the garlic paste and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.
Add the capsicum, coriander-kashmiri dry red chilli powder, green chillies and ginger and sauté on a medium flame for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 5 minutes ,while stirring occasionally.
Add the dried fenugreek leaves, salt and ¼ cup of water, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute, while stirring occasionally.
Add the paneer, mix gently and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: Simply place paneer slice and pudina chutney on the slices to prepare the paneer sandwich, which is not only simple and quick sandwich recipe but also provides you with protein and calcium.
preparationMethod: Take the bread slices and trim the edges.
On one bread slice apply butter, keep 3-4 round cut cucumber slices.
On that place a slice of paneer,spread pudina chutney on it.
Take another slice of bread and apply tomato sauce, and cover on the above slice.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: If you want to make it more tasty than fill the stuffing even to the edges. This is a very unique and tasty recipe. Do try it!!
preparationMethod: Combine the paneer, onions, tomatoes, green chillies, salt, pepper, coriander in a bowl and mix well. Keep aside.
Remove the edges of the bread slices and apply ghee on one side of each slice.
Spread a portion of the stuffing on 6 bread slices and sandwich with another bread slices.
Grill or toast till it turns crisp.
Serve hot with tomato sauce.
Heat the oil in a fry pan. Fry onion and garlic till fragrant.
Add zucchini and eggplant slices and stir fry till they are cooked but not mushy.
Add curry powder and stir fry for few seconds.
Add paneer, tomato ketchup, and salt. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Melt the butter for sauce and fry Maida till the raw smell is lost, without browning it.
Remove from fire, slowly stir in cold milk, mixing well all the time, to avoid lumps.
Cook the sauce stirring well, till it just begins to boil.
Stir in 1/2 the cheddar cheese. Add salt, pepper and mustard powder.
Grease an 8" square oven proof glass dish.
Trim away the crust from 6-8 slices of bread.
Butter half the slices and line the base of the dish with them, buttered side down.
Spread the paneer vegetable mixture over it. Place a layer of bread over it.
Pour the sauce on top and sprinkle with cheese.
Beat the egg (optional) lightly and pour on top.
Dot with butter and bake in a hot oven (200 C) till golden brown on top. Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Paneer sandwiches are a nutritious and delicious sandwich recipe with spicy crumbled paneer as filling.
preparationMethod: Combine the onion, green chillies, coriander, salt and pepper in a bowl and mix well.
Add sweet chilli sauce and mix well.
Spread a portion of the mixture on 6 bread slices and sandwich with remaining 6 bread slices.
Grill or toast till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: The panner cubes are stir fried with veggies and simmered in schezwan sauce.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the paneer and capsicum and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the onions and tomatoes and saute for 3 minutes.
Cover and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the salt and chilli sauce, mix well and serve hot.

recipeDescription: Spicy fusion of chatapata spices with bland smooth paneer.
preparationMethod: Place the sev puris on dry plate and keep the paneer slice on the puri and then sprinkle dry masala powder on it.
Place 1 -2 tsp of bhaji on each puri, cover with grated cheese and then nylon sev.
Sprinkle coriander and serve immediately.

recipeDescription: A simple soup recipe, paneer soup is packed with protein and a great taste. A perfect soup recipe for children during cold winter days.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a deep pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and crushed ginger and garlic and saute for few seconds.
Add the paneer and toss well.
Add 4 cups of water, pepper and salt, mix well and add the cabbage so as to cover the soup.
Cover with a lid and simmer for 5- 8 minutes or till the cabbage gets cooked.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: This is very tasty and delicious.
preparationMethod: Take 2 slice of bread, cut into round shape.
Dip bread into water and extract extra water.
Mix paneer and all ingredients an fill into the bread.
Roll in the vermicelli.
Deep fry until golden brown.
Serve hot with green chutney.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: A Healthy option to today’s junk food especially for children. It is highly welcomed even by elders.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a pan, add the garlic and sauté a little.
Add ginger-chilli paste, sliced onions and sauté till translucent.
Add the red chilli paste and mix well and add the remaining ingredients and toss well.
Allow to cool a little.
Keep aside.
Blend the sprouted moong, ginger-green chilli paste and enough water to prepare a batter of dropping consistency.
Add the turmeric powder, coriander, 2 tsp hot oil, soda bi carb, salt and whisk well.
Simmer oil on an non stick tawa, spread laddleful of batter to prepare a 5-6 inch pancake. Drizzle oil and flip when under side is done.
Cook till the other side is done.
Spread the green chutney on the pancake and place the Paneer Stuffing on it and fold the sides.
Serve hot immediately with ketchup.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: To make this open sandwich more rich you can add chopped and boiled mushrooms or mixed veggies.
preparationMethod: Combine the paneer with onions and ginger in a bowl and mix well. Keep aside.
Lightly beat the cream and add salt, pepper and mustard powder and mix well.
Add the paneer mixture and spread this on the lightly buttered bread pieces.
Grill for 4-5 minutes and serve hot with green chutney.

recipeDescription: An all time favourite recipe made zero oil suiting the palate of all health watchers!
preparationMethod: Bring enough warer to boil in a deep pan and add the tomatoes, onions and cashewnuts and boil for 5 minutes.
Drain, cool and blend in a mixer along with garlic and ginger till smooth.
Transfer the mixture into a non-stick kadhai and add the tandoori masala, kasuri methi and salt, mix well and saute for 2 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine the tomato ketchup with malai and mix well.
Add this to the cooked gravy and simmer for 3 minutes.
Add the paneer and cook for more 2 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Again here is something different type of sandwich in form of footlong sandwich with the combination of paneer mixture with lots of vegetables.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a pan, add paneer and the remaining ingredients, mix well and saute till the paneer turns soft.
Keep aside.
Cut the bread from center and apply little butter on both the sides.
Arrange few lettuce leaves and place 6-7 tomato slices, sprinkle sandwich masala on tomatoes.
Arrange 7 to 8 cucumber slices followed by capsicum and spread half of the prepared paneer mixture, 1 tsp mustard sauce and 1 tsp mayonnaise and 1½ tsp chilli sauce evenly on top.
Place 3 to 4 olives and jalapenos and cover with lettuce leaves and sprinkle sandwich masala.
Cover with other slice and similarly prepare other sandwich.
Cut and serve immediately.
